Text: The political crisis that is shaking us is harming and weakening our democracy to a certain extent, but it will not beat us. We are stronger than it. Israeli society is stronger than it.

Receiving the election results today. 

I truly hope that the elected officials, representatives of the public, are able to hear the Israeli people's call for out-of-the-ordinary coalitions, collaborations across sectors, working for the good of all of Israel’s citizens.
Chag #Pesach Sameach to you all!

Following the tradition, I was honored to sell Beit HaNasi's chametz with the assistance of Sephardi Chief Rabbi of #Jerusalem Shlomo Moshe Amar today. 

May we know good and safe days, and good health for all Israelis. Chag #Pesach Sameach!

Visiting the Central Elections Committee at the Knesset. A professional and dedicated system, working around the clock to provide solutions that ensure the right of every citizen to vote. Thanks to CEC Chairman Judge Uzi Fogelman and CEO Adv. Orly Ades. Israel trusts you.
أعزاءي، للمرة الأخيرة، من قلب الرئيس إلى قلوبكم- رجاءً، أخرجوا وصوتوا. من أجل أولادنا، من أجل أحفادنا ومن أجلنا جميعا.

My dear ones, for the last time, and from the heart of the president to yours – please, go and vote. For our children and grandchildren, for all of us.
#israelelections #IsraElex4

Thank you to the Central Elections Committee, headed by Judge Fogelman this time, which ensures the right of every Israeli to vote, and that the process will be carried out according to the regulations across the country.
#israelelections #IsraElex4

With all the difficulties of the current situation, elections to the Knesset are the pinnacle of our democracy.
Four elections in two years erode public trust in the democratic process, but only you can influence. There is no other way.
#israelelections #IsraElex4
For the last time as president, voting in the elections for the 24th Kneseset. Live broadcast from Yefe Nof school in Jerusalem. #IsraElex4

A pleasure to welcome 13 ambassadors to the State of #Israel to Beit HaNasi today to get to know more about the presidency in Israel and our work here.
Beit HaNasi is the home of the Israeli people and is open to visitors from near and far. 
🇩🇴🇦🇺🇦🇴🇨🇴🇪🇹🇫🇮🇦🇹🇱🇻🇸🇻🇸🇰🇹🇭🇺🇾🇲🇲
#diplomacy

A proud moment at the end of a day of meetings in Vienna.
The Chief of Staff and I had a very moving video call this evening with our humanitarian mission to Equatorial Guinea that went to help casualties and save lives after the disaster there. 
We saluted them, with love.

We will remember and never forget.
Wreath-laying ceremony at the monument to Holocaust victims in Vienna’s Judenplatz

Credit: Amos Ben Gershom (GPO)

A working meeting with Austrian Chancellor @sebastiankurz.
I thanked him for his consistent support in the fight against antisemitism, and for Israel’s security and his work to promote Israeli-Austrian relations 🇮🇱🇦🇹

Credit - Amos Ben Gershom (GPO)
Continuing my visit to Europe, in Vienna for a series of meetings. Thank you to my friend President @vanderbellen for the moving reception ceremony 🇮🇱🇦🇹

Thank you to the Austrian leadership for standing with Israel in the international arena, and for its commitment to #Israel  security. #Corona has taught us how important it is to work together when facing complex challenges. We must learn this lesson and implement it.

The Abraham Accords are an opening for real regional change which we hope will also be reflected in relations with the Palestinians. Yet, Iran continues to strengthen. The international community must recognize this threat and take a strong line against it.

#Austria's leaders are taking a clear stance against #antisemitism and are promoting #Holocaust remembrance and study, as well as protecting the Austrian Jewish community. We will continue to deepen the cooperation between us in all fields.
Joint statements to the press from Vienna with my friend President @vanderbellen:

Continuing my visit to Europe, in Vienna today for a series of meetings 🇦🇹🇮🇱
Thank you to my friend President @vanderbellen for the moving reception ceremony for @IDF Chief of Staff Kochavi and me.
Honoring the State of Israel in the sky. As we came in to land at Vienna, two fighters of the Austrian Air Force escorted our plane 🇦🇹🇮🇱

Delighted to be the guest of President Steinmeier and his wife for an official dinner this evening at Schloss Bellevue.

Credit: Amos Ben Gershom (GPO)
Meeting with German foreign minister @HeikoMaas, talking about how to further strengthen relations between our countries and the need to stop discrimination against #Israel in international bodies.
I stressed that we will not cease until our boys, held by Hamas, return home and asked for #Germany to continue its involvement in this issue that is so close to our hearts.

We trust our #European friends to stand with us against Iran's nuclear program and its support for terrorist organizations and against the misuse of the ICC against our soldiers and citizens, for us and for generations to come.
#Germany today exhibits an extraordinary commitment to #Israel 's security and to preserving stability in the Middle East.

My remarks today in #Berlin, in joint statements to the press with my friend President Steinmeier 🇮🇱🇩🇪
@IsraelinGermany

Meeting my friend President Steinmeier, including a comprehensive briefing on regional security from @IDF Chief of Staff.
Germany’s commitment to Israel’s security, regional stability and fighting antisemitism are very important to us.

Official reception ceremony on arrival in Berlin 🇩🇪🇮🇱

Credit: Amos Ben Gershom (GPO)

Dedicating the new student dorms at Ma'ale Shahak today in Dimona, named after former IDF Chief of Staff and minister Amnon Lipkin-Shahak ז"ל.
I have worked with Ayalim and Negev and Galilee Development for many years and now is the time to say thank you. You make us so proud!

I have been following with concern the issue of selling collections from the Museum of Islamic Art including items whose value is greater and more significant than their monetary value.
My heartfelt thanks to all those who helped arrive at the hoped-for result we are seeing now.

Back to sport, gradually and responsibly, is back to life. 
Visiting Wingate Institute today with the Minister of Culture and Sport as part of Israeli Hope in Sport, I met our Olympic hopes in Judo and synchronised swimming and wished them luck for #Tokyo2021

We must be on guard, strong and united, to ensure that everyone has a place in the complex fabric of our society. This is the way Israel was created, and this is how we will ensure national resilience.

Protecting partnership is this generation's task, and @IDF plays an important part in it. 
Meeting the senior command of the Intelligence Branch today, I asked "How diverse are your units? Do your people reflect Israel's population? And what are you doing to encourage diversity?"

Marking #InternationalWomensDay at Beit HaNasi with the opening of "Moon Reflected on Asphalt" an exhibition from "Studio of Her Own", a joint project of Israeli women artists from across our society. 
Your love of creativity and wonderful art is soul food for us all.

The sound of enthusiastic applause returned to Beit HaNasi this evening for the first time since the outbreak of #coronavirus, marking #InternationalWomensDay with @HabimaTheatre and Haifa Theater's tribute to women in theater: "Women Create Israeli Theater"
The show must go on!

The Jerusalem Municipality's "Passing It On" run for women came to Beit HaNasi this morning with women medical professionals running for #InternationalWomensDay 
I join the call for equal pay and representation of women. This is not just a women's campaign, it is for us all.
Thank you, @Pontifex

With Dor, Carmel and Khouloud at a Tel-Aviv Yafo youth center, who told me about the tough socio-economic impact of #coronavirus. 
I believe in our young people and we must not lose them. We must grow together out of this crisis and rebuild our economy in the digital, global era.

The State of Israel is a strong, Jewish and democratic state which knows how to defend itself and to investigate itself when necessary. 

We are proud of our soldiers, our sons and daughters, the essence of our people, who stand guard for their country generation after generation

The decision of the International Criminal Court at the Hague to commence investigations against the State of Israel is scandalous. 

We will not accept claims against the exercise of our right and our obligation to defend our citizens.

Continuing my round of visits to hospitals this morning in support of our medical teams, today at Wolfson Hospital in Holon.
I heard about the big impact of the vaccinations on the infection rate and call again on all those who have not yet - go and get vaccinated.

استلمت اليوم أوراق اعتماد السفير الأول لدولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة في إسرائيل. 
هناك الكثير مما يمكننا تحقيقه معاً، إسرائيليين وإماراتيين، للدفع بشعوبنا، بالشرق الأوسط كله إلى الأمام. نحو مستقبل يقوم على التعاون الاقليمي، الاحترام المتبادل، الازدهار والسلام. أهلا وسهلا! 🇦🇪🇮🇱

!Ahlan wa'Sahlan .Diplomatic credentials ceremony for the Ambassador of the United Arab Emirates, live from Beit HaNasi أهلا وسهلاً بسعادتكم! حفل تقديم أوراق اعتماد أول سفير لدولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة في إسرائيل، ببث حي ومباشر من ديوان الرئيس.

Esther Horgen ז"ל, murdered by a despicable terrorist, left behind her immense love and light, creativity and art.
An honor to receive "Megilat Esther Horgen" from her husband Benjamin, with her illustrations, a mark of the power of good over terrible evil. 
Chag Purim Sameach

New ambassadors to Israel!
Receiving diplomatic credentials this morning at Beit HaNasi from the new ambassadors of #Ukraine, #Brazil, #Portugal, the #Philippines, the #DominicanRepublic and #Ecuador to the State of @Israel 

🇺🇦🇧🇷🇵🇹🇵🇭🇩🇴🇪🇨🇮🇱

لقاء عمل رسمي مع وزير النفط والموارد المعدنيّة في مصر، معالي الوزير طارق الملا. بين إسرائيل ومصر تسود علاقات سلام منذ أكثر من أربعة عقود. نحن مستمرّون في تعزيز الشراكات وأطر التعاون المهمّة بين الدولتين، والعلاقة بين شعبيهما في شتّى مجالات الحياة.

A working meeting with Egyptian Minister of Petroleum and Mineral Resources Tareq Al-Molla.
#Israel and #Egypt have been at peace for more than 40 years. We will continue to strengthen the cooperation between the countries and the connections between our peoples in all fields.

An eyesore and heartache. At the beach in Herzliya today with the mayor to thank the wonderful people who came to give a hand. These sights are a wake-up call and we must work on a national environmental plan to protect our children’s and grandchildren’s futures.

Knowing that my father's translation of the Quran is in #KhastImam in #Tashkent, is deeply moving. The values I learnt from him still guide me. Religion can connect peoples and cross borders, and we must ensure it does so. Sending warmest wishes to our friends in #Uzbekistan.

How do you say "I love you" in sign language?
Noa from Ma’agalei Shema visited today to teach me, and gave me an opportunity to thank the organisation for its important work with the deaf and hard of hearing.

Photo: Mark Neyman (GPO)

Woe upon our flora and fauna, our seas blackened with tar. Now is the time for a national plan, before we face a dreadful ecological disaster. 
Thanks to all the wonderful people who helped. This should be supported by an organised plan for any events like this in the future.

Every year on 7 Adar we gather at Har Herzl, Jerusalem's hill of tears and longing, to remember Israel's fallen soldiers whose place of burial is not known.
We promise to continue working so that every one of our soldiers comes home for burial.
May their memories be a blessing.
A white morning at Beit HaNasi

Rehov HaNasi and Beit HaNasi in #Jerusalem are wearing white tonight! ❄️❄️❄️

(Photo credit: Tal Ashkenazi)

The prospect of snow didn't stop us going out to support the medical teams today at Jerusalem's @herzog_hospital, working round the clock with elderly patients and the young on respiratory support to fight #coronavirus.
It is our shared duty to protect and care for our elderly.

A gathering this evening that was all Uri Orbach, a language virtuoso who made us laugh, but also laughed at us in his own quiet way, with a little smile under his moustache.
Dear Uri, I am sure you are still laughing from up there, and loving this country deeply. We miss you.

@AuschwitzMuseum In memory of Lotte Weiss ז"ל, whose dedication to Holocaust remembrance and educating young people is a shining example to us all.
May her memory be a blessing.

اليوم ايضا، مع ملائكة الرحمة الذين يقفون على الخطوط الأمامية في الحرب على هذا الوباء اللعين، وهذه المرة في المركز الطبي للجليل في نهاريا، أشد على أياديكم باسمنا كلنا. فلنخفف عنهم ونحمي أنفسنا - أخرجوا للتطعيم.

With the guardian angels who are on the front line of the war against #corona again today, this time at the @GalileeMedical_ Center in Nahariya.
Let's make their work easier and protect ourselves by getting vaccinated.
Meeting with President @AnastiadesCY of #Cyprus today.

A working meeting with Pres. @AnastasiadesCY of #Cyprus. I welcome the recent agreement on flights and tourism between our countries and call on others to adopt 'Green Passes'. #Coronavirus has shown us that today's challenges know no borders. We must work together to meet them.

I wrote to DM @gantzbe today asking to investigate the damage to the altar site at Har Eival and to ensure no such damage happens again. 
It is inconceivable that we, whose roots are in these places, do not ensure that that our heritage sites are protected from damage and harm.

I call on everyone from here, each one in their own field, to do everything in their power to remind Israeli society in all its diversity that mutual responsibility and respect, belief and the Israeli Hope that we can live together – these are our compass and our way.

Receiving the Unity Scroll of the Social Forum today, Rav Grossman's initiative aimed at healing the rifts in Israeli society, particularly with #coronavirus. 
Unity and mutual responsibility - our Jewish and democratic 'togetherness' - are key to getting through this challenge.

Warmest congratulations to @TheGenesisPrize 2021 winner Steven Spielberg.
His unique creativity, resolute opposition to antisemitism and dedication to Holocaust remembrance inspire us all. 
Dear Steven, you bring great pride to the Jewish people, in Israel and around the world.

Visiting the Kinneret Innovation Center where I heard about agricultural and technology innovation: drones to corral cattle, generating electricity from water systems and vegetable-based preservatives.
This is Tikkun Olam in action - innovation to fight global hunger and want.

Making our way through the snow today to meet the reservists of the @idfonline Alpinist unit.
The peaks of Mt Hermon are not covered in snow all year, but the threats we face are constant. We must be ready for any scenario and guard our borders day and night, whatever the weather

2021 @WolfPrize_ laureates:

Physics - Prof. Giorgio Parisi 
Medicine - Prof. Joan Steitz, Prof. Lynne Maquat and Prof. Adrian Kraine
Chemistry - Prof. Leslie Leiserowitz and Prof. Meir Lahav
Music - Stevie Wonder and Olga Neuwirth

Hosting the announcement of the 2021 @WolfPrize_ for outstanding contributions to science and art. Human progress is an achievement not to be taken for granted. Congratulations to the laureates who join an elite group of scientists and artists working for a better world for all.

Israel rejects the ICC's assertion of authority to rule on the Palestinian question. It exists to deal with mass atrocities, not to pursue a democratic state with an independent, effective judiciary. We will continue to protect our people from this invalid, political decision.

Meeting Cpl. Lianne, FSgt. Y and Cpl. A who prevented recent terrorist attacks. 
Their actions are clear proof of the complex reality we live in and the need to defend ourselves, particularly in light of the political claims against us by international bodies such as the ICC.

Awarding prizes today to 27 outstanding national-civilian service volunteers, a microcosm of Israeli society: Jews and Arabs, religious and secular who serve our country and society. You are our Israeli Hope. Bless you!

Happy to host the launch of the Israeli Press Institute today, the initiative of former supreme court judge Dalia Dorner, a vigilant advocate of journalistic ethics. It aims to redefine the blurred borders between propaganda, marketing and real journalism. I wish it great success
Thank you to the medical teams, from the bottom of my heart, from me and all Israelis. Thank you for your boundless dedication in fighting the pandemic. You're the best!

Visiting Shamir Medical Center today in support of the medical teams dealing with #coronavirus.
The innovative breath test I tried gives an immediate corona diagnosis and could replace the swab test, and the hyperbaric chamber does wonders for those with respiratory difficulties

Geha has seen a 30% rise in new referrals during corona, and occupancy has risen to 115% since the first lock-down. Mental health is an integral part of our overall health and we need to do everything possible so the medical teams can successfully deal with these challenges.

“I came here because of depression and anxiety. I heard a voice telling me to take my life” 14-year old M, a patient at Geha Mental Health Center, told me with great frankness on my visit today. He and a group of children shared their stories and the treatment that helps them.

We cannot accept that this generation of boys and girls are growing up in a society where it is so clear that the fact a girl is Jewish or Arab, that a boy is secular, religious or ultra-Orthodox, is what will determine their level of education and their quality of life.

Receiving the Children in Israel report from the National Council for the Child, with worrying data on #coronavirus and our children.
We citizens must say: after the elections our elected officials must ensure a good present and a better future for our children. All our children

Happy #TuBishvat, everyone!

(Archive picture - Mark Neyman, GPO)

Visiting new mothers today, I spoke with Ilana and her beautiful baby Lia on the corona ward at Ichilov Medical Center. I heard about the huge difficulties of giving birth during the pandemic and the wonderful support of the medical teams. Mazal tov, dear Ilana!

Today, #InternationalHolocaustRemembranceDay I spoke with my friend the President of Germany. Our shared message of #NeverAgain is as strong as ever. I thanked him for his commitment to #Holocaust remembrance and the fight against #Antisemitism and #racism of all kinds.

Speaking this morning with Sheikh Mowafak Tarif to send blessings to him and all Druze for Nabi al-Khadr.
His brave decision to cancel the holiday festivities is a shining example of responsible leadership.
Kul 'am wa-antum b'kheir!

To mark #InternationalHolocaustRemembranceDay , the Lonka Project's exhibition is on display at Beit HaNasi and at the Willi-Brandt Haus museum in Germany, as well as a joint statement with my friends the President of Germany and the President of the European Council:
#WeRemember

54 new judges were sworn in today at Beit HaNasi. 
I told them not to allow attacks on them to cloud their judgement, or anything to influence them apart from the law. Their opinions should not be influenced by passing fads, only by the values of the Jewish and democratic state.

Meeting @IL_police Commissioner Koby Shabtai today. Public spirit is high and the police are in the middle. We trust you to enforce the law with tolerance and sensitivity while not tolerating violence from anyone. The critical right of protest must not be violated with violence.

Congratulations to President @JoeBiden, 46th President of the United States, and to Vice President @KamalaHarris. The people of @Israel salute you and wish you great success.
@POTUS
#InaugurationDay2021 

Photo credit: Mark Neyman (GPO)

I call on the Israeli government, those at its head and the ministers of finance and health: intervene in this crisis now. The hospital heads need the budgetary issues resolved, allowing their teams to deal with the patients.

Meeting today with heads of Israel's hospitals and hearing their difficulties, which are our difficulties. 
We cannot allow our public hospitals to collapse. We cannot allow #coronavirus to defeat our hospitals, We cannot beat it without them.

Speaking just now with Moreinu Rabbeinu Rabbi Yisrael Meir Lau, inquiring after his and his wife's health. 
I sent the prayers of the entire people for his speedy recovery and a refuah shleima.

Getting the economy and the private sector back on its feet is ‘everybody’s business’. The pain felt by the self-employed and small business owners is ‘everybody’s business’. Israeli innovation and creativity turning a complex and difficult challenge into a tremendous opportunity

Small businesses are the oxygen of Israel's economy. In Bat Yam today where the pilot of Everybody's Business, an initiative of Facebook Israel and the Socio-Economic Forum with Beit HaNasi, has ended successfully, helping small businesses build online presence to survive corona.

Saddened by the passing of Sheldon Adelson, who loved the Jewish people and Israel, was a great American patriot, and who strengthened the bonds between Israel and America with boundless generosity.
Condolences to Miriam and to the whole family.
May his memory be a blessing.

Saluting special education, the teachers, therapists and all those who continue to envelop our special children with love during these difficult days of #coronavirus. Visiting @BeitIssie today, and sending my thanks and blessings to you all, across the country.

Happy Israeli Doctors' Day to all our wonderful doctors!

On behalf of us all, thank you for the fantastic work you do, night and day, now more than ever. God bless you all!

There will be better days. We have gone through bad times in the past and overcome them. The effect of the vaccine is close at hand. We will return to normality. Until then, be patient and disciplined and do everything to minimize infection.

Just before the lockdown, today we distributed the 5000th computer through Mitchashvim to school kids from all parts of Israeli society.

 We will continue to close the digital gap together with our many partners in this important initiative, making sure no child is left behind.

There will be better days. We have gone through bad times in the past and overcome them. The effect of the vaccine is close at hand, and we will return to normality. Until then, we must be patient and disciplined, and do everything we can to minimize infection.

Do your duty. The lockdown, with all its restrictions as decided by the government, applies to us all. We are going into lockdown to protect our children. We, all of us and without exceptions, must follow its rules.

Congratulations to President-elect @JoeBiden, with the certification of the election results by Congress. I am sure that the President-elect will continue to strengthen the relations between us and #America, our closest friend and the greatest #democracy in the world.

Wishing my dear friend President Frank-Walter Steinmeier of #Germany a very happy birthday!
Herzlichen Glückwunsch zum Geburtstag! 🇮🇱🇩🇪

President Rivlin's greetings for Novy God 2021

Snobim Godem!

С Новым годом! С Новым счастьем!

Ahead of the new year, we held the traditional reception for heads of #Christian denominations in @Israel. 

The State of Israel will always be committed to #freedom of religion and  be proud of the Christian communities in the Holy Land. A happy and healthy #newyear2021 to all!

Thank you to the medical teams, the true heroes of 2020. I hope that 2021 brings a government that can work with you and ensure that you have the right conditions - budget, staffing and equipment - so you can continue with your wonderful work.

Meeting the wonderful healthcare workers at the Maccabi vaccination center today in Jerusalem. Two weeks into this huge operation, it was very exciting to see thousands of people getting the vaccine every hour. At this pace, we can turn the corner and start to get back to normal.
Welcome home to Jonathan and Esther Pollard!

A farewell meeting at Beit HaNasi with @UN Middle East Peace Process Special Coordinator @nmladenov, a true friend of @Israel. I thanked him for his work in our area over the last 5 years, setting new standards of professionalism and insight.

Hosting Vital Zinger, Paralympian and disabled rights leader as part of the Equal in the Livingroom initiative where people with disabilities share their stories online. 
They, like all Israelis, are entitled to full equal opportunities and we must continue to work on this issue.

Tenth of Tevet, the day that marks the beginning of the biblical siege of Jerusalem, and the day of mourning for victims of the #Holocaust. I was honored to recite Kaddish on my visit to Dachau concentration camp in their memory. We will never forget.
#MerryChristmas to our Christian friends in Israel and around the world!

Awarding the #GenesisPrize2020 this evening to #NatanSharansky
Natan, there is no one more deserving of this prize. You are an inspiration to us all
Thanks to the Genesis Prize for your important work bringing together the Jewish people in Israel and the world
@Isaac_Herzog

A condolence call today at the home of Esther Horgan ז"ל, who was murdered this week by evildoers in the Reichan Forest in Samaria. The spirit and strength of her husband Binyamin and their children give us so much strength.
Dear Horgan family, all Israel is with you in your pain

This may be the last @IAFsite wings ceremony I take part in as president. They have always been inspirational and a great source of pride to me. 

And you, dear graduates, are an example and role model to us all. Take wing, fly high and come home safely!

A pleasure to welcome @USAmbUN Kelly Craft and our Ambassador to the UN @giladerdan1 for a working meeting. Our friendship is rooted in the values of democracy and freedom. Thank you for supporting @Israel at every opportunity at the UN, Ambassador Craft.

The cruel murder of Esther Horgan, who left her house yesterday and did not return, cut short a full life of wonderful works, of home and family, of creativity and care. I have full faith that our security forces will get to the despicable murders and that justice will be done.

Bravo à  @AprilBenayoum, première dauphine de @MissFrance2021! Les attaques antisémites contre vous sont dégoûtantes. On ne peut pas rester en silence. Nous sommes unis face à chaque manifestation d'antisémitisme. Nous le combattrons et nous le tolérerons pas, nulle part au monde

When you go and get vaccinated, you are not only taking care of your own health, but of those around you. You will also be helping everyone to return to normal life. You will be helping the economy to restart and to take some of the enormous pressure off our medical teams.

Concerns are legitimate, but remember that the vaccines in Israel have gone through meticulous processes, passed stringent checks and been approved by the US @FDA and the @IsraelMOH for whom the value of human life, trust and accuracy are guiding lights. We can trust them.
I got the corona vaccine. Dear Israelis, go and get vaccinated too.

Miracles happen every day at Adi Negev - Nachalat Eran, a loving home for babies, children and adults with severe disabilities. I met volunteers and agricultural workers there today, along with graduates who have returned to work there as counsellors, bringing light and hope.

Speaking to Governor-General David Hurley of Australia this morning about the Malka Leifer case. The recent developments are a very significant step in the proper conclusion of this difficult matter. I hope that this will lessen, if only slightly, the victims' terrible suffering.

Lighting #Chanukah candles with the men and women of the Mossad
Your dedicated and daring service for #Israel's security may be out of sight, but we know that without we would not be truly safe. Outstanding Mossad officers, today's Maccabees, congratulations and #ChanukahSameach!

Wishing success, health and well-being to HM King Hamed and the Bahraini people on #Bahrain's National Day.
May others follow the brave and historic peace with #Israel, creating inter-cultural discourse and interreligious cooperation, enriching lives across the entire region.

تمنياتي بالخير والعافية والسعادة لصاحب الجلالة الملك حمد بن عيسى آل خليفة وللشعب البحريني بمناسبة الاحتفال باليوم الوطني للمملكة. عسى أن يسير الآخرون على خطى السلام مع إسرائيل، لنبني معا خطاب التعاون والتفاعل الحضاري والثقافي والديني من أجل خير ورفعة جميع شعوب المنطقة.

A pleasure to host an exhibition from the Jerusalem Biennale of contemporary chanukiyot, the work of nine #Israeli artists.
On holidays and every day, now more than ever, there is nothing like Israeli arts and culture.

I spoke to D, next head of the Mossad, and Maj.-Gen. Kobi Shabtai, our next Police Commissioner. I told them both they do us great credit as public servants of this country. We have full faith they will protect us at home and abroad.

Lighting candles for the sixth night of #Chanukah  with @IDF soldiers along the Jordan valley border. Your daily achievements and successes in maintaining peace and security are true heroism. 
Chag #ChanukahSameach  to all those protecting us!

أهلا وسهلا! استضفت اليوم وفداً من المؤثرين على الرأي العام من البحرين والإمارات المتحدة.
السلام يصنع بين الناس وبين الشعوب، ووصول الوفد للقدس اليوم هو خطوة أخرى في طريق بناء العلاقات الوطيدة بين الدولتين.

Ahlan wa-sahlan! Meeting a delegation of opinion-leaders from #Bahrain and #UAE this morning. 
Peace is made between people and nations, and this delegation's visit to #Jerusalem today is another step towards our good and warm relations.

تحدثت اليوم مع العاهل البحريني. إنها سنة حافلة بالتطورات التاريخية بين إسرائيل والبحرين والإمارات، وهذا التقدم لم يكن ليحصل لولا القرار التاريخي والشجاع لتحقيق السلام مع إسرائيل. السلام مع البحرين مثال يحتذى به للعديد من الدول في منطقتنا، وأتطلع لاستضافة جلالته في القدس قريبا.
Peace between #Israel and #Bahrain is already a model for other countries in our region. I hope to welcome His Majesty to Jerusalem, the city of peace and God, soon.

Speaking to my friend HM King Hamad today, I said that this is a year of historic developments between #Israel and #Bahrain which could not have happened without his brave and historic decision to establish warm peace with Israel.

Speaking to @Pontifex ahead of Christmas in the shadow of #coronavirus. We have a moral obligation to ensure that all countries receive the vaccine and to follow instructions, even at the expense of our holiday celebrations. Wishing all Christian communities a Merry Christmas!

This year has been full of positive development and change in the Middle East. I congratulate you, the Prime Minister and President Trump for the #MoroccoIsrael  agreement, which increases peace and stability with the Arab world and the countries of the Mediterranean.

Lighting Chanukah candles with FM @Gabi_Ashkenazi with heads of Israel's overseas missions online. 
To the men and women of @IsraelMF: thank you for tirelessly bringing the miracle that is #Israel to the world. On behalf of all Israelis and myself #ChanukahSameach!

Lighting #Chanukah candles with my neighbors on HaNasi St, for our last time together.
True, I'm not always an easy neighbor with the traffic, but tonight was a wonderful opportunity to be together and to thank you, before I move out. 
#ChanukahSameach to you all!

Happy #Chanukah !
#ChanukahSameach !

Happy #Chanukah !
Chag #ChanukahSameach to all of you!

Each year is just as exciting.
 Presenting 14 outstanding GSS officers with certificates of outstanding achievement. They are a defensive wall that allows us to live our lives in peace and we owe them and their families our deepest thanks.

Working meeting with FM @AranchaGlezLaya of #Spain, during which we talked about #coronavirus that we are all dealing with. 
I sent my support to the Spanish people affected by the disease and my hopes that we will soon get through this difficult time.

Proud to support , a moving tribute by @ChelseaFC to Jewish athletes murdered during the Holocaust. 
Sport is very close to my heart and can be a great force for good. We must ensure it is free of anti-semitism and racism of any kind.
#SayNoToAntisemitism

Launching Beresheet 2, Israel's second spacecraft to the moon, a project that will open the eyes of Israel's next generation to space and allow every child to dream.
Thank you @TeamSpaceIL continuing to dream big and aim as high as possible!

A working meeting with PM @JJansaSDS. I thanked him for #Slovenia's support for #Israel  and for its steadfast stance on the threats to our security. We will continue to develop the relations between our countries and reach new heights.

@IDF has the might and power to create change and build bridges across the country. I would like to congratulate the Chief of Staff on his decision to expand Atidim and similar projects. I am sure we will see the fruits of it soon.

Marking 20 years of Atidim. When we see the worrying figures about social gaps that make it hard for those from #Israel's periphery to get into the elite @IDF 8200 unit, we must not give up on a single person - wherever they were born, brought up or educated.

I was happy to hear that the first doses of vaccine are expected to arrive in #Israel in the next few days. 

I'm ready, of course.

Congratulations to Givatayim, Ariel, Yesod HaMa'ala and Emek Hefer, winners of the Recycling Authority's prize, to Hod Hasharon and Bnei Shimon RC for honorable mention and Tzemach Refuse and Prigat for the special award. 
And, don't forget - packaging goes into the orange bins!

The @IDF's Refaim multi-dimensional unit that I visited today shows that the Tnufa multi-year program is being implemented on the ground. 
True , most of this important work is far from visible, but be sure that this cutting-edge unit is ready for anything. I'm proud of you.

Lighting up #Israel in purple!
Beit HaNasi is joining the events marking the International Day for People with Disabilities with purple lights in the ceremonial hall.

Popoarele noastre împărtășesc o îndelungată și strânsă prietenie. Împreună, privim către un viitor luminos, cu cât mai multe realizări 🇮🇱🇷🇴
#1decembrie

Congratulations to President @KlausIohannis and to all our friends in #Romania on your national day! Our peoples share a long and close friendship. Together, we look to a bright future with as many achievements as possible. 🇮🇱 🇷🇴

Warm congratulations to Odelia Fittousi who has been elected as a member of the @UN #CRPD panel for persons with disabilities. I am sure your important voice at the UN will be a positive influence for people with #disabilities around the world. We are so proud of you!
@UN_Enable

Meeting this morning with representatives of Restart, who showed us devices specially adapted for injured @IDF veterans. Thank you to these wonderful people who fulfil our society's moral obligation to take care of those injured protecting us all.

Chanichei Bnei Akiva - Hashem imachem.
This year, Shabbat Irgun won't be the same. It's an excellent opportunity to send you my love and support for your fantastic work all year, and especially right now.
Be'lev amitz  uv'ezrat Hashem - aloh na'ale!
Shabbat shalom from Jerusalem

Thank you Ambassador Antanaviciene of #Lithuania for presenting me with this coin on behalf of President @GitanasNauseda, marking 300 years since the birth of the #VilnaGaon. My family came to Jerusalem in1809 as his followers, and this is a moving closing of that circle for me.

An honor to welcome  delegation from the King Hamad Global Center for Peaceful Coexistence. #Israel and #Bahrain value freedom of religion and tolerance. I thank the Kingdom of Bahrain for supporting peace and its Jewish community, and standing against antisemitism.
@GlobalHamad

#DiegoArmandoMaradona, el Pibe de Oro, trajo alegría y luz a millones de personas durante su deslumbrante carrera. Nuestros pensamientos y oraciones están con su familia, el pueblo #Argentino  y los seguidores de su hermoso juego de todo el mundo.

#DiegoArmandoMaradona, el Pibe del Oro, brought joy and light to many millions of people in a dazzling career. A true legend.
Our thoughts and prayers with his family, the people of #Argentina and followers of the beautiful game around the world.

Our hearts are with the families of the IAF reserve pilot and flight school cadet who were killed today in a training flight crash.
The loss of such young life is heart-breaking. 
Dear families, family of the @IAFsite, I feel your pain. May their memories be a blessing.

Ben-Gurion was a man of vision, with his feet on the ground. He took difficult decisions, some of which came at a heavy cost. But he also knew that it was possible to establish a people, establish a state, only by living in the present while also forging a path for the future.

At this time, we need to do both. To deal with the present with clarity and determination without ignoring the failures but acknowledging the situation as it is. And at the same time, putting down anchors for the future.

If we lived without dreams, without belief, without solidarity, Israel would look completely different. If we do not understand that the way out of this crisis is our common responsibility - every part of Israeli society - it will be far harder to overcome it.
It has made many of us retreat within ourselves, trying to survive and preserving energy to get through each day, each week. But this is not the character of this people or this country.
For nearly a year, we have been living only in the present. The global pandemic has created a health, social and economic crisis across the world, and here in Israel.

The official memorial ceremony for David Ben-Gurion ז"ל, marking 47 years since his death.

Live broadcast (Hebrew) from Sde Boker

Over the years we have shared in Jonathan Pollard's pain, and felt a responsibility and commitment to bring about his release. Now we will be able to welcome him and his family home after many difficult years of imprisonment and restrictions, to a new life of health and peace.

Thank you to the Washington Institute for Near East Policy for awarding me their prestigious Statesman Scholar Medal for 2020.
@WashInstitute #TWISSA2020

Visiting the Dead Sea to meet with tourism minister @FarkashOrit and industry leaders. I am happy that #Eilat and the #DeadSea are now 'tourism islands'. Physical health and mental health go together and it is vital that we can take a break safely. 
@IsraelTourism

A proud night for #Israel! 🇮🇱
Congratulations to Deni Avdija, picked 9th in #NBADraft by @WashWizards, while Yam Madar, 47th pick, is going to @celtics.

@bahdiplomatic
A first working meeting with the Foreign Minister of the Kingdom of Bahrain. Livestream of statements to the press from Beit HaNasi, Jerusalem.

Meeting heads of the Christian denominations in Israel with COGAT ahead of #Christmas. With #coronavirus, I asked the church leaders to stress the importance of following the guidelines to their communities, and wished them an early Happy Christmas

Speaking just now with President-elect @JoeBiden to congratulate him, I said that as a old friend of #Israel he knows our friendship is based on values beyond partisan politics. We have no doubt that under his leadership the United States is committed to our security and success.

I was so happy to harvest olives today together with students from the Joint Israeli Leadership Academy, for the last time during my presidency, in the gardens of Beit HaNasi. Olives are a symbol of peace and these young people are our future - true Israeli Hope!

Marking Yom Aliyah, Immigration Day today. Eretz Yisrael, the Land of #Israel is a place of choice! And we, the State of Israel, have the mission and duty to take care for every one of you who chooses to make Aliyah and come here.

An exciting day at Beit HaNasi.
Godspeed to you, #EytanStibbe and thanks to @RamonFoundation for supporting the initiative. 
Go in #peace, return in peace.
We're waiting for you here at home 🇮🇱
#Space
We cannot celebrate this joyous day without remembering Ilan, Rona and Asaf Ramon ז"ל. Their absence today reverberates to the heavens, so present, so palpable.

A day of great national joy and pride. It's not every day that we announce an Israeli astronaut is going to space. Eytan Stibbe will fly with the blue and white flag his uniform, reminding us that the sky is no longer the limit!

To our brothers and sisters of the Ethiopian-Israeli community - Sigd Sameach!

Our thoughts are with the families of the victims of the tragic fire yesterday at the ICU in Piatra Neamt and for the speedy recovery of all those injured  

The Israeli people stands with #Romania, and we send our deepest condolences to its people and to President @KlausIohannis

Wishing all our friends in #India and around the world

Happy Diwali/Deepawali!

#Diwali2020

My deepest condolences to the eight families  who are mourning the loss of their loved ones today in the US, France and Czechia. They served their countries and @fcmfo with distinction. Their loss is a tragedy. My prayers for the full and swift recovery of the survivor.

Delighted to welcome Bulgarian FM and Deputy PM @EZaharievaMFA to Beit HaNasi for a working meeting,  marking 30 years of diplomatic relations between #Israel and #Bulgaria. We will continue strengthening and deepening the ties between our two countries. 🇮🇱🇧🇬

It was an honor to receive diplomatic credentials today from the new ambassadors of Malta, Australia, Guatemala, Cyprus and Turkmenistan to the State of Israel. To many more years of friendship between our countries and peoples 🇹🇲 🇨🇾🇬🇹🇦🇺🇲🇹🇮🇱

On my way to visit Ashkelon, I stopped for a coffee at Yifat in Mishmar David. 
Now, more than ever, buy #Israeli. Standing together with our small businesses.
The witnesses to Nazi crimes are leaving us. We bear the duty to remember. To remember and to ensure – never again. It is in our hands. This is our watch.

Like scientists in laboratories and research institutes, we the leaders of the world, bear the responsibility for working in our social laboratories to mount a determined and uncompromising attack on any expressions of antisemitism, racism and xenophobia.

The virus of antisemitism, racism and xenophobia is tougher than coronavirus. It changes shape, takes cover and threatens to break out through any crack. But there can and there must be a vaccine for it, too.
Responsibility to act, and not to stand by in the face of antisemitism and racism, in the face of radical forces that sow chaos and destruction, hatred and fear.
Nearly a year ago, last January, we stood here together in Jerusalem. Dozens of monarchs, leaders, heads of states, and we promised to remember. To remember and to take responsibility.

When we mark each year the events of the cursed Kristallnacht, we remember its victims. But we also insist on remembering how hate, when it reaches the heights of divisiveness, can shatter the very foundations of society – of humanity and human rights – into a thousand fragments.

That black night was the opening shot in the Nazi’s cruel plan. It was a trial balloon to test how deep the hatred for Jews had reached, and how far the public would let the Nazi leadership take its murderous intentions – with enthusiastic participation, or with tacit agreement.
In the shadow of these outrages, 30,000 Jewish men were sent to the concentration camps at Buchenwald, Dachau and Sachsenhausen.
Jewish-owned shops and businesses were looted and destroyed. Synagogues were torched, burned to the ground. There is scarcely a remnant of the synagogues of Germany and Austria since then.
On the night of 9-10 November 1938, the earth trembled in Germany and Austria. In a matter of hours, dozens of Jews were killed. Hundreds of others were beaten and humiliated.
Never Again: Commemorating Kristallnacht. Live broadcast from Beit HaNasi, Jerusalem.

Celebrating the centenary of the Archeological Council with a unique 2nd Century BCE altar recently found in northern Israel. 
Thank you to @IsraelAntiquity for placing wonderful finds at Beit HaNasi for safekeeping, reminding us of the profound links between us and our land

#NeverAgain means never again. 
Join the livestream from Beit HaNasi tomorrow, 9 November, 10:00 EST / 15:00 CET / 17:00 Israel, to mark the anniversary of Kristallnacht, with the Presidents of Austria and Germany.
Together, we will illuminate all the  synagogues around the world
Marking 68 years since the death of our first president, Dr. Chaim Weizmann ז"ל.  May we continue to dream of additional stories in building our shared home. May we dream and do.

I send my blessings and the blessings of all the people in #Israel to our friend @JoeBiden on your election as the 46th President of the United States of #America, and also to Vice President-elect @KamalaHarris. I wish you congratulations and much success.

I have no doubt that our special relations and multifaceted cooperation will continue to flourish and grow in the future. 

On behalf of the Israeli people, I wish you and your future administration great success, and extend my invitation to you to visit Jerusalem as our guest.
This is also the time to thank President Trump for four years of partnership in strengthening Israel’s security, and to thank the American people for their steadfast support and friendship.

The strategic alliance between our two countries and peoples is stronger than any political leadership, and is not based solely on friendship. It is rooted deeply in our shared values and in our long-standing commitment to freedom and democracy as the foundations of our societies
Mr President-elect, as a long-standing friend of Israel, you are now the leader of the free world and of the State of Israel’s closest and most important ally.

I send the blessings of the Israeli people and of the State of Israel, to our friend Joe Biden on your election as the 46th President of the United States of America. I also send congratulations and best wishes for your success, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.

Mourning the loss of Rabbi Lord Jonathan Sacks ז"ל.
We will always remember his warning against violence in the name of God and his belief that we can heal a fractured world.
Condolences to his family, to British Jewry and to his students. May his memory be a blessing.

I spoke to my friend President @vanderbellen of #Austria to mourn the victims of the despicable terrorist attack in Vienna, and to pray for those injured.
Together, we will strengthen freedom, tolerance and democracy. Together, we will fight terror, hatred and violence.

I was glad to hear that the infection rate is falling, but there are also warning lights. We need a large number of tests to halt the spread of the disease. My fellow Israelis - please do not ignore it. Go and get tested.

The first stage in @IDF's operation to deal with #coronavirus patients at Rambam hospital has ended, and I went to show my appreciation to the medical and support teams. I heard from the patients about the wonderful care they received.

These soldiers saw deployment in outposts and in combat to defend the communities of the north, fought in battle and in some cases did not return. My appreciation for the committee headed by Lt.-Gen. (res) Shaul Mofaz for this meaningful and historic process. God bless you all.

IDF Chief of Staff Lt.-Gen. Aviv Kochavi’s decision to award a campaign medal for Israel’s combat in Lebanon is an appropriate and important step, reflecting our appreciation for the dedication of a generation of soldiers who defended the State of Israel’s northern border.

Even when it's raining and under the #coronavirus restrictions, it was an honor to receive credentials today from the new ambassadors of #Belgium, #Uzbekistan, #Sweden, #Norway and #Latvia to #Israel. To many more years of friendship between our countries and peoples 🇧🇪🇺🇿🇸🇪🇳🇴🇱🇻🇮🇱

Diplomatic working meeting with Romanian PM @orban_ludovic. I thanked him for his country's strong stance against antisemitism at home and across Europe. We will continue to develop the good relations between our countries particularly in the fields of economy and security.  🇷🇴🇮🇱
Great to stop on the way and to meet the wonderful @IDF soldiers in the area and to learn up close about the obstacle which keeps the area and us all safe.

I also visited the Sion Medical factory, a leading global brand for masks and protective equipment. Great pride for Israel. 
Wearing a mask is vital - and if we can support local industry at the same time, even better.

Visiting Sderot today to hear how they have successfully contained the coronavirus pandemic led by mayor @AlonDavidi. The impressive control room he opened gives personal service to each one of the residents.

Today, the Knesset is marking Agriculture and Settlement day.
Supporting local agriculture should be a national priority, particularly when so many Israelis - small businesses, entrepreneurs and farmers, are suffering in the corona economy.
Now is the time to protect our farmers.
Our thoughts and prayers are with the people of #Austria as we follow last night's despicable terrorist attack in #Vienna with concern.

I too am taking part in the wonderful initiative of #TheShabbosProject! I’m sending #flowers_for_shabbat to everyone at @Naamat who have found refuge and a home away from home.

Sending much strength and wishing you safety and happiness - and hope the flowers bring you a smile.

First day of school (again) for our dear 1st to 4th graders. Celebrating today at Jerusalem's Keshet school with the education minister and mayor. Thank you, teachers, for your devotion and adaptability in these challenging days.

A working meeting with Italian FM @luigidimaio 
I sent our prayers to all Italians and to the country's Jewish community, which have been hit hard by #coronavirus. We will continue to cultivate the good relations between our countries and work together to beat the pandemic.

Our hearts are with the families of the victims of today's despicable terror attack in a church in France and our prayers for the recovery of those injured. 
Terrorism, violence and hatred are modern plagues that blight our world.
Notre coeur est avec la France.

Wishing President Milos Zeman and all our friends in #CzechRepublic a happy independence day.

May your country continue to flourish and prosper, and may the strong relations between us continue to grow and deepen.

Starting the runners in the last km of the #גמאני_רצה run for #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth. Every woman dealing with breast cancer, every woman who recovers is an entire world. Please get checked, persuade your partners, mothers, daughters, friends. It saves lives.

Beit HaNasi is marking Breast Cancer Awareness Month today by launching the #גמאני_רצה race from the gardens. We're also marking it with pink lighting, in the spirit of the month. Please, go and get checked. 
 #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth

The museums in our country are the repositories of enormous spiritual and material assets and we must do all we can to keep them in Israel. I thank the Minister of Culture and Sport, the Attorney-General and the State Prosecutor’s Office for urgently examining this issue.

I am following with concern the issue of the sale of collections from the Museum of Islamic Art, including items of greater worth and significance than their monetary value. We must find the means available to prevent the sale of these cultural assets from the region as a whole.

Wishing my friend President Andrzej Duda of Poland a full and speedy recovery. Get well soon.
@prezydentpl

Today is Aliyah Day, celebrating over 3 million Israelis who immigrated here. Their skills, talents, culture and history enrich our shared society and country. Our diversity is one of our greatest strengths.

Dozens of brave women like R are living in shelters while others pay the price with their lives every day, and we are not doing enough to save them.

We must implement and fund the national plan to fight violence against women. We must save the next woman.
"If I hadn't come here, I probably would not be alive" said R who came to a Naamat shelter for women victims of domestic violence. She left everything behind; her abuser is living his life as normal.

The determination of Gandhi's generation to establish the state is needed now as we fight for life under the shadow of corona, for health and the economy, for education and culture. 

May the memory of Rehavam Ze'evi (Gandhi) be a blessing

Wishing my dear friend @rabbisacks Refuah Shlema, a full and speedy recovery. Get well soon, we need your voice now more than ever.

As a people, we must return to our compass, we must look forward and begin a process of repair – long, deep and systemic. As we learned in the IDF, when you get lost when navigating, you go back to the starting point.

Beit HaNasi is joining @zakaHQ's "Don't Leave Them Behind" project. We will call elderly people living on their own to see how they are doing.

Meeting with the men and women of @israelpolice today to thank them for their tireless work.
