As the lockdown comes into force and we are in our homes, tens of thousands of policemen and women are deployed across the country, for us and to protect our personal security and our health.

I spoke a short time ago with acting Police Commissioner Moti Cohen, who has been without a formal appointment for so long but does his duty with full force, professionalism and determination. I thanked him and the Israel Police for their dedication. Chag Sameach and Shana Tova!

Because we have no other land, we have no other country , we have no other people and we have no other way. May this be a healthy year, in body and in spirit. May the old year and its curses pass; may the new year and its blessings come. May it be so.

My fellow Israelis, you cannot beat corona alone, but no-one can beat it without you. I believe in this people; I believe in our ability to prevail. This is the time to follow the instructions, to take care of yourselves and those dear to you.

When we are fighting corona, we are together – Jews and Arabs, secular, religious and ultra-Orthodox – in hospitals, schools and in charitable organizations. Together, we learn in times like this what partnership is, what mutual responsibility is, what Israeli Hope is.
We will not prevail through finger pointing and toxic accusations. Only together.

We must refrain from blaming other parts of the society as if one sector is ‘responsible’ for spreading the disease. Every group and community in our society plays a crucial role in our combined strength and in our ability to win this battle.
This is a second chance and we must take it because we will not, I fear, get a third one.

And from here, I want to say to the government of Israel – its leaders, ministers and advisors: the trust of the people is beyond value. We must do everything to restore personal, medical and economic confidence to our fellow citizens.

Since the outbreak of the pandemic, I have gone to where the battle is being fought and met with those who care for you, my fellow Israelis, and are doing everything to win this battle, and I ask you – put your trust in them.
I am sharing these feelings with you, and at the same time I would like us to raise our heads and believe.

I think of those with mental health issues in hostels, of soldiers, of parents in old-age homes. The lockdown means that our ability to live together, to celebrate together, to mourn together, to pray together, to fulfil our most basic human needs together – all these are harmed.
I understand the feeling that none of these were done satisfactorily. And now, today, my fellow Israelis, we are forced to pay the price again.

You, the citizens of Israel, deserve a safety net that the country gives you. Decision-makers, government ministries, policy implementers must work for you and only for you. To save lives, to reduce infection, to rescue the economy.

We celebrated with our families under great restrictions, we mourned our dead in a way unworthy of them, we lived our lives in a painful compromise in the belief that the country and its institutions would get us out of this crisis quickly.

You paid a high price, a real price for a long time – our synagogues were closed on Pesach, our mosques were closed during Ramadan, and until today I grieve when I think of the bereaved families who were unable to visit the graves of their loved ones on Yom Hazikaron.

When the coronavirus burst into our lives, we thought it would be a tough battle, but we hoped for a swift victory and so we accepted the restrictions of social distancing with understanding, despite the costs it entails.

I apologized for it in the past, and I am doing it again today. My loneliness is no more painful than the loneliness that many of you – who were so careful to follow the word and the spirit of the instructions – experience. I also ask your forgiveness today at a national level.

I understand the feelings of confusion and uncertainty, the anxiety that many people are feeling. I understand and, first and foremost, want to apologize for that. On a personal level, I ask your forgiveness for my behavior here at Beit HaNasi during the lockdown during Pesach.

اتفاقيات السلام التي وقعّناها مع الإمارات العربية والمتحدة ومملكة البحرين، هي بداية عهد جديد للشرق الأوسط كله. عهد للسلام بين الأمم والشعوب.
نسأل الله لمزيد من الإنجازات المشابهة في المستقبل القريب وأن ينعم على المنطقة كلها بحياة سلام، مع جميع جيراننا. السلام عليكم!

The peace agreements signed with the UAE and Bahrain are the beginning of a new era across the entire Middle East. An era of peace between peoples and peace between nations. Inshallah, more agreements will come soon and we can live in peace with all our neighbors. Salaam Aleikum!

Our prayers are with those injured in the rocket attacks last night in Ashdod, and our support for @IDF which has been in action responding to the attacks from Gaza. We will not allow terrorism to go unanswered. The security of Israeli citizens will not be neglected.

I hope and pray that this coming year will be a year of breaking down more barriers, opening doors and borders,
working together to overcome shared challenges
and advance mutual understanding, peace and cooperation,
in our region and around the world.  
שנה טובה! Shana Tova!

I hope as well that this spirit of cooperation will help us build a future of trust with our Palestinian neighbors. I look forward to welcoming the ambassadors from the UAE and Bahrain at our next diplomatic reception.

Together, we can lead the Middle East down a new path of hope, peace, tolerance and cooperation. I hope that many more Arab and Muslim countries follow your lead and that we see a new era of peace among nations, P2P, people to people, peace to peace.

I invite you to come to Jerusalem, the City of Peace, the city where members of all religions - can worship freely. 
Ahlan wa'Sahlan!
I would like to take this opportunity to address from here HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan and HH King Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa. Thank you for your leadership and courage in making peace.

Friends, soon we will witness an historic event: the signing of agreements between #Israel and the #UnitedArabEmirates and between Israel and the Kingdom of #Bahrain. This is a true example of breaking down borders, and overcoming divisions.

LIVE NOW: New Year's diplomatic reception with foreign ambassadors to the State of Israel, including an address to the nation by President of Israel Reuven (Ruvi) RIvlin ahead of the signing of agreements with the UAE and Bahrain.

The New Year diplomatic reception with foreign ambassadors to the State of Israel. Join the #live broadcast from the ceremony, including an address to the nation by President of Israel Reuven (Ruvi) RIvlin ahead of the signing of agreements with the UAE an

Every year on Yom Haatzmaut, I present 120 outstanding @IDF soldiers with the President's Award. This year, we had to wait until now for this moving ceremony.
#Congratulations to those who were recognized, without their families, but with great #pride in our hearts. I salute you!

Launching "Character and Caricature", an exhibition of 24 works that tells #Israel's history through #cartoons of its presidents, as well as the story of our talented artists who reflect for us the here and now, social and political, with such great skill.

Awarding the #Israel Defense Prize this evening to 3 outstanding projects. I can't tell you anything about them, but believe me - they make us all proud. 
It's not just the ability, the out-of-the-box thinking or the team work. It is about always getting there before the enemy.

I would like to express my appreciation to the prime minister, the King of Bahrain, the President of the US and all those who worked on this wonderful #achievement. I call on other Arab and Muslim countries to make #peace with Israel, peace between peoples, peace for peace.

The #agreement between Israel and the United Arab Emirates has opened a new chapter in the Middle East and we are seeing the #change it is bringing to our region with the decision by Bahrain to also take the path of friendship and establish full relations with the State of Israel

Working meeting with Romanian FM @BogdanAurescu. We spoke about the excellent relations and continued #cooperation between our countries, the Romanian-Israeli community that links our peoples and the #opportunities that the agreement with @UAE will open 🇮🇱🇷🇴

Our prayers this morning for the recovery of the policeman and @IDF soldier wounded in the vehicle-ramming attack at Tapuah junction. 
Thanks to the force that acted quickly on the spot to neutralize the terrorist. #Terrorism must be defeated; we will fight it without compromise.

I stressed how important it is that these efforts lead to a full arrangement, including the return of our boys held by Hamas, and the security of our people. We will not accept a reality of #terrorism against #Israeli citizens or soldiers under any circumstances.

I spoke with the Qatari special envoy, Ambassador Mohammed al-Emadi, and thanked him for his committment and his intensive efforts to stop the escalation and to calm the situation, which are taking place alongside the @IDF's daily defensive and offensive operations.

Condolence call at the home of the family of Rabbi Shai Ohayon ז"ל, murdered in a terrorist attack last week. 
We have lost a special soul, a devoted son from a wonderful family, a man of study and deeds, a wise and caring father and husband. 
We will never give in to terrorism.

Working meeting with Alternate PM and Minister of Defense @gantzbe discussing the security situation n the south and north of the country,  new opportunities with the normalization of relations with UAE and @IDF efforts to dealing with the #Coronavirus pandemic.

#Israel stands with the people of #India and the family of former President Shri Pranab Mukherjee in mourning his passing. A statesman much respected at home and abroad and a true friend of Israel who strengthened the deep ties between our countries and peoples. ॐ शांति। Shalom.

A #historic and moving moment in Abu Dhabi today,
a moment of #peace. 

Let us hope this visit opens a new chapter of peace between nations and peoples, and that it leads to similar breakthroughs soon.

A working meeting with @jaredkushner, Senior Advisor to President Trump and members of the visiting US delegation. I call on more Arab and Muslim states to follow in the path of @uaegov and establish full and warm relations with @Israel - peace between nations, between peoples.

Our thoughts are with the Ohayon family whose son Rabbi Shai was murdered by a despicable terrorist. 
We have lost a man of Torah, a font of knowledge, a father of four children. The terrorist and his accomplices must face justice. Terror must not win
May his memory be a blessing

We have learned recently that we cannot live in a bubble, unaware  of those around us. Today, at the @TelAviv-Yafo municipality's #coronavirus control room, I met people who work for others, for all those among us who are finding things tough.

The sickening desecration of the Holocaust remembrance site at Ouradour-sur-Glane is another reminder that antisemitism remains amongst us. We must not, will not, allow any form of racism or discrimination to stand. Never again is not a slogan - it is a pledge to defeat this evil

Opening the school year on 1 Elul, as I have done every year as president, this year at Ben Ish Hayil school in Rehovot.
As we open our schools, may we also open our hearts to mutual responsibility and offer a helping hand to each other. 
Chodesh Tov and Shabbat Shalom

Another tough night for Israelis in the south. We are with them and appreciate their resilience. We will not stand by while Hamas is out of control. Fires, rockets and explosive balloons will not become routine. The @IDF will not relent until quiet returns.

An important meeting with the heads of the health service today, thanking the medical teams on behalf of us all. I am sure we will applaud your endless and devoted work again. We are many and you are few, and we must do all we can to give you the support you deserve. 
@IsraelMOH

During their flypast of Dachau today, pilots of the @IAFsite carried the message 'never again' to the whole world. I spoke to the commander of the air force from Jerusalem, but my heart was with them on German soil, in their tribute to remembrance and the future.

A moving event, opening "Beit Nechama for Children and Young People" in Netivot today, named after my Nechama, our Nechama. A place where two things Nechama loved - young people and things that grow - will be looked after. Thank you to the mayor and people of Netivot.

So saddening to see this good earth go up in flames. Visiting the @IDF Gaza Coordination and Liaison Administration at the Erez crossing point, and places where fires have been set. 
These attacks are #terrorism, plain and simple and we have to fight it.

At the beginning of my meeting with the prime minister, I congratulated him, President Trump and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Zayed on a great achievement that could bring important change in the history of the Middle East and the history of the Israeli people and the Jewish people

كتبت لولي العهد بأنه ليس لدي أدنى شك بأن الأجيال القادمة ستثمن الطريقة التي أعدتم بها أنتم، القيادات الشجاعة والحكيمة، إطلاق خطاب السلام والثقة والحوار بين الشعوب والأديان وإلى تعزيز التعاون. لا أخفي أملي بأن تكون هذه الخطوة قدوة ترسم الطريق للآخرين أيضا.

بعثت برسالة لولي العهد @MohamedBinZayed ودعوته لزيارة أورشليم القدس. كلي أمل بأن الاتفاق القريب، سيساهم في تعزيز الثقة بيننا وبين شعوب المنطقة، ثقة تُرسخ روح التفاهم بيننا جميعا، ومن شأنها دفع منطقتنا إلى الأمام وتوفير الازدهار لسكان الشرق الأوسط

In my letter, I wrote that I have no doubt that future generations will appreciate how brave and wise leadership restarted the discourse on peace, trust, dialogue between peoples and religions, cooperation and a promising future, a beacon, illuminating the road ahead for others.

I sent a letter to Crown Prince @MohamedBinZayed and invited him to visit Jerusalem. I am hopeful that the agreement between our countries will help build and strengthen the trust between us and the peoples of the region, bring economic benefit and regional stability.

We must join forces to fight lawlessness and illegal weapons wherever they are. Meeting with representatives of the Mothers for Life protest march today. Your protest is not for Israeli-Arab society alone, but is our society's as a whole. It is everyone's responsibility.

With wonderful, #inspiring olim hadashim learning Hebrew at @JewishAgency's Ulpan Etzion. #Israel is not just another country to immigrate to. We go up to Israel, the home of the Jewish people. You are not alone, you are home.

Prof. Ruth Gavison was a brilliant jurist. Her acute and complex thinking, crystal clear and bright, could not be pigeonholed. In word and deed she put the 'and' between Jewish and democratic, democratic and Jewish.
Our society and our country will deeply miss her voice.
الاتفاق بين اسرائيل والامارات العربية هو نقطة تحوّل استراتيجيّة نحو مسارات جديدة في منطقتنا. كلي أمل  على ان تدعم هذه الخطوة الثقة بيننا وبين شعوب المنطقة حتى الوصول لوفاق واسع وثابت بين الجميع.

I congratulate the President of the United States @realDonaldTrump, the Prime Minister of Israel @netanyahu and Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed @MohamedBinZayed on this impressive achievement and invite the Crown Prince to visit Jerusalem. Ahlan wa’Sahlan."

The agreement between Israel and the UAE is an important and strategic milestone for new opportunities in our region. I hope that this step will also lead to strengthening trust between us and the peoples of the region, and to a broad-based and stable understanding among us all

Visiting the wonderful Kfar Idud today where people with disabilities help produce military equipment that keep our soldiers safe.
As we slowly return to normal life and work, we know that we still have a long way to go in reducing the infection rates.

The discovery of the Dead Sea Scrolls enthralled us in the first decade of Israeli independence.  Delighted to accompany their reinstallation at the  Shrine of the Book, ahead of the museum's reopening tomorrow where this priceless cultural asset will be back on public display.

Further elections are not possible. We cannot continue to deal with this as a logical possibility while we are counting our dead. If you take us there, elected officials of whatever party, to that dreadful nadir, you will inflict on this country a hard, painful, unforgivable blow

It's no secret that these are tense times on our northern border. Israel does not seek conflict, but we have a professional army which is more prepared after each exercise. Meeting today with soldiers and officers of @IDF Golani brigade, on exercises in the north.

Our hearts mourn the passing of Rabbi Adin Even Israel Steinsaltz זצ"ל. He was a man of great spiritual courage, deep knowledge and profound thought who brought the Talmud to Am Yisrael in clear and accessible Hebrew and English.
May his memory be a blessing.
יהי זכרו ברוך.
We share the pain of the Lebanese people and sincerely reach out to offer our aid at this difficult time.
We share the pain of the Lebanese people and sincerely reach out to offer our aid at this difficult time.

Eid Said to Israeli Muslims and Druze, and to all those celebrating #EidAlAdha!
Kul 'am wa-antum b'kheir!

أعزائي مواطنو دولة إسرائيل المُسلمون والدروز، عيدًا سعيدًا، وكل عام وأنتم بخير!

A Tisha b'Av study session on National and Individual Loneliness with @JewishPolicy, @URJPresident Rabbi Rick Jacobs, Rabbi @RJSchonfeld and JAFI Chair @Isaac_Herzog 

Together, we will overcome this crisis. 𝘕𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘢𝘮𝘶, 𝘯𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘢𝘮𝘶 𝘢𝘮𝘪. Comfort ye, comfort ye my people.

Happy to read that since 2014 the number of Haredim working in hi-tech is up by 52% and the number of Haredim studying engineering and hi-tech professions by 35%. 
There is also a rise of 90% in Haredi women working in hi-tech in the last four years. A source of real pride.
Join the event with translation to English and Hebrew at:
Join us for a Tisha b'Av learning event, as part of which President Rivlin will deliver an address to the nation, broadcast live on Facebook at 10:00 EST | 15:00 CET |17:00 Israel

If you have decided to join a protest, any protest, to support any idea – I call on you, please, make sure to do so in a way that keeps safe distances and preserves public order, is in coordination with the police and respects the State of Israel

Violence and incitement are not, and will not be, tolerated. Those who incite, those who call for violence, those who raise a hand against the protesters, must and will be dealt with by law enforcement officials to the fullest extent of the law
The right to protest is a treasured value in our democratic culture; it must not be harmed. It is one of the values on which the Jewish and democratic state, which is so dear to us all, is based.

Packing vegetables today with volunteers from @leketisrael and agriculture minister @alonschuster_mk as demand for food boxes is on the rise.
Yes, need is present and real. We need to fight to uphold the value of mutual responsibility at times like these.

Stop the talk of early elections, of that terrible option at  this time, and save yourselves from it. 
The State of Israel is not a rag doll you drag around as you squabble. The people need you all to be focused, clear and finding solutions to this crisis.
It's in your hands.

I would like to address the government as a whole.
Like all citizens of this country, I look on the developments in the Knesset with deep concern as they  shake the already fragile relations between coalition partners. As a citizen and on behalf of us all, I say: get a grip!

Our hearts are with the family of IDF Sgt Sahar Algazer ז"ל, killed yesterday in an accident in the Har Dov area and pained by the loss of young life. Dear Algazer family, I feel your pain. May his memory be a blessing. 
Praying for the recovery of the injured IDF officer.

Bonne Fete Nationale!
Gelukkige Nationale Feestdag !Schönen Nationalfeiertag!

Congratulations to all our friends in #Belgium celebrating their country's national day today 🇮🇱🇧🇪

Speaking to president @RealFloPerez of @realmadrid to congratulate him on #winning @LaLiga for the 34th time.
As we all face the uncertainties of corona, #sport can still bring us joy, and bring us #together
#HalaMadridYNadaMas!

Sending warmest birthday wishes to our dear friend @AngelaMerkelCDU!

Herzlichen Glückwunsch zum Geburtstag aus Jerusalem! ⁦🇮🇱⁩🇩🇪
The Lebanese people are not our enemies, but its government is responsible for what happens in its territory. We will not stand by if our sovereignty is breached in any way.

Iran and Hizbollah are attempting to destabilize the region and we will not allow it. The full and effective implementation of the UNIFIL mandate is essential for maintaining stability and quiet and preventing Hizbollah gaining strength.

20 years since we left Lebanon. Today, looking over the Galilee, I met the commanders who know this complex area personally, every hill and track in southern Lebanon, and the tough days after.
I welcome the Chief of Staff's decision to consider awarding them a campaign medal.

Meeting today with Health Minister @YuliEdelstein and D-G of @IsraelMOH who briefed me on current patient numbers and efforts to halt the spread of the virus.
Beit HaNasi will assist the ministry in any way required. I am confident will get through these tough times together.

Hapoel Beer Sheva have won the cup! 
#Congratulations on winning the soccer State Cup to @HBS_FC

Singing Hatikva at the State Cup final in a stadium without fans but with hearts full of pride for two fantastic teams who worked hard to get here. Cheering them both on behalf of all their supporters!
@offimpt @HBS_FC

At the official memorial ceremony for Binyamin Zeev Herzl:
"In Altneuland, Herzl envisaged a liberal democracy. Majority rule was not enough, he thought, to ensure just and enlightened rule. It needed independent and strong institutions."

It was a great pleasure and a source of great pride to meet the winners of the Van Leer Prize for Excellence in the Humanities, awarded to outstanding high school students for their senior thesis. They are a shining example of the creativity, keen intelligence and daring of youth

Today, 17 Tammuz, marks three weeks before the destruction of the Temple. We think of how crises begin and unfold. We learn to look out, to be aware and not to ignore the first small cracks. 
That is what this day calls us to do. Hear the call and seek to repair those cracks.

Receiving diplomatic credentials, in a different and smaller ceremony in line with coronavirus restrictions, from new #ambassadors to #Israel. Welcome to the ambassadors of Colombia 🇨🇴 Greece 🇬🇷 Denmark 🇩🇰 Romania 🇷🇴 and Argentina 🇦🇷!
@IsraelMFA

I have decided to award, for the first time, a special commendation to Michael Ben Zikri ז"ל, whose actions set an example of outstanding civic action. 
I have invited Michael's family and the family of Karem to Beit HaNasi at the end of the mourning period for Michael ז"ל.

Visiting Eilat, Israel's tourism capital where the sun always shines, this morning. I met residents, hoteliers and business people who are dealing with coronavirus. 
Holiday in Israel, if you can - in hotels, tents or guesthouses - all according to the guidelines, of course!

So proud to hear this morning's news of the successful launch of the 'Ofek 16' satellite to space. Thank you the experts at the Ministry of Defense and Israel Aerospace Industries.
@modisrael @ILAerospaceIAI

On the way to Eilat, the only city I have lived in apart, of course, from Jerusalem. I am going to hear from its residents about how they are coping with corona, and from the heads of Israel's tourist industry in the city where the sun always shines.

Opening the first Israel-@OECD conference today, marking 10 years of #Israel's membership. 
There is an inherent tension between the aspiration to be the start-up nation and to excel, and the need to care for those left behind. We can do both, and it is in our nature to do so.

Hosting an emotional reunion today at Beit HaNasi between new @IDF 2/Lt Becky Maman and her family who came from Toronto for her passing-out ceremony. 
We are proud of all our new officers, the next generation of commanders.

It was a pleasure to speak to President @s_sommaruga of #Switzerland, a long-standing friend of Israel. We spoke about the coronavirus pandemic in our countries, about areas of cooperation in fighting it and about the regional challenges we face at this time.

Eight years since the passing of Prime Minister Yitzhak Shamir ז"ל. His voice and vision still reverberate in the consciousness of Israelis. 
As he hoped, history remembers him as a man of Eretz Yisrael and of Am Yisrael, always working for unity. 
May his memory be a blessing

There were no crowds to cheer the new officers who completed @IDF Officers' Course this evening, but they deserve our congratulations. 
I am sure that one day, every Israeli young person will be able to serve #Israel in a meaningful way. 
Go on your way and come back safe to us.

Dear Shmuel - our kids'education, the future of Israeli society and Israeli Hope were your responsibility as D-G of @edu_il.
With your impressive achievements in public life, I know you will contribute to Israeli society for many years to come. Thank you and good luck!
Congratulations to @LFC, Premier League champions, and the English team I have followed for so many years. "At the end of a storm, there's a golden sky." #YNWA
3 Tammuz, the yarhtzeit of the passing of the Lubavitcher Rebbe, who loved all Jews and all people. Watch:

You, the men and women graduates @IAFsite flight school's 180th course, overcame all obstacles, touched the blue beyond and proved that for you the sky is no limit. We are proud of you. Spread your wings, fly high and come home safely.

Condolences to the Wachsman family, who are so dear to us. We remember Yehuda, a man of faith and of peace, warm and sensitive. A father who asked that the unity we felt in those awful hours waiting to hear the fate of Nachshon ז"ל would never end. May his memory be a blessing.

A farewell meeting to wish my friend minister Gilad Erdan all success as he leaves on the important mission as our ambassador to the US and the UN. I am sure Gilad will strengthen and develop our relations with our closest ally and wish him and us a successful term of of office.

I spoke with Chair of @yadvashem Avner Shalev who announced yesterday that he is leaving after 27 years of service. A partner in the historic Holocaust Forum in Jerusalem this year and a guide on our work on the Holocaust I hope we all benefit from your advice for many more years
We work closely with @edu_il through Israeli Hope in Education, providing educational encounters for students and faculties to meet the tribes that make up  Israeli society.

An important working meeting with the Education Minister, who is working even harder than usual to ensure the safety and education of Israel's children.
@yoavgallant
Sending best wishes for the speedy recovery of Nursultan Nazarbayev, first President of #Kazakhstan. Our two countries continue to enjoy excellent relations.
Visiting the laboratories of the Brain Sciences Center at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem today, where they are doing groundbreaking work to fight coronavirus,

Welcome to Jerusalem, @PrimeministerGR Kyriakos Mitsotakis! 🇮🇱🇬🇷
We hope the skies open soon, and that we can restart flights from Israel to Greece and Cyprus.

Video - Roi Avraham, sound - Nir Sherf (GPO)

This year we celebrate 30 years since the important decision to upgrade relations between #Israel and #Greece. Today we enjoy flourishing ties in a wide range of fields. That is of no surprise. After all, our two Mediterranean peoples have so much in common.

Holding a first working meeting since the outbreak of #coronavirus today with @PrimeministerGR Kyriakos Mitsotakis. His visit in these challenging days is further testimony to the strong relations between our countries. I hope flights between Tel Aviv and Athens resume soon 🇮🇱🇬🇷

Congratulations to the 26 organizations given @TheGenesisPrize Speak Out For Israel award today.
Their work to improve Israel's standing around the world, fighting antisemitism and advancing Israeli values of tolerance, democracy, culture, science and innovation make us all proud

At the same time, an epidemiological investigation is being carried out under the close instructions of the District Health Officer and tests for coronavirus are being carried out according to need and contact with the affected employee.

Beit HaNasi has been cleaned after receiving information yesterday that one of its workers has coronavirus, disinfecting all offices, including bathrooms and kitchens. The president’s private office was cleaned thoroughly and he will resume working from it tomorrow.

There will be no work at Beit HaNasi tomorrow and necessary cleaning and tests will be carried out. The Ministry of Health is working closely with Beit HaNasi on the epidemiological investigation and further instructions. The president's schedule for tomorrow will be rescheduled

At this time, contacts between the employee who has the virus and all those with whom they came into contact are being charted according to the instructions of the Jerusalem District Health Officer at the Ministry of Health Dr Chen Stein-Zamir, and in consultation with her.
In line with instructions from the Ministry of Health, President Rivlin is not required to self-isolate at this stage.

During Shabbat, Beit HaNasi was informed that one of its members of staff tested positive for coronavirus.
Consultations are now taking place with relevant authorities from the Ministry of Health regarding who will be required to isolate, and the implications for President Rivlin

Together with FM @Gabi_Ashkenazi on a video conference this evening with American Jewish leaders in light of current events there and #coronavirus. We stand together with our brothers and sisters in Jewish communities around the world against all forms of antisemitism and racism.

An important and thorough meeting with my friend Finance Minister Yisrael Katz who is working hard on the budgetary aspects required to support every Israeli through our current complex challenges.
@Israel_katz

I spoke today to President Frank-Walter Steinmeier of #Germany about issues on the regional agenda. We agreed that his state visit to Israel, originally scheduled for last month, will happen as soon as possible.
Holding my first working meeting today with leader of the opposition @yairlapid  MK. We spoke at length on matters at the heart of Israeli concerns.

Proud of the security forces who captured the terrorist who murdered IDF Staff Sgt Amit Ben Yigal ז"ל after many nights of relentless pursuit.
We will act uncompromisingly against terrorism and its perpetrators to keep Israelis safe.

38 years since the First Lebanon War. 38 years of longing for those we lost. 
We will not hesitate to strike the enemy, anywhere, we will not be deterred from conflict and we will not tolerate any threat to our lives. We are strong. We are prepared. We are determined.

Happy #WorldEnvironmentDay2020!

Together, we can make our world a better place.

The verbal violence, the name-calling, the ridiculing, and the contempt must stop. I, who remember well the attempts to silence the critics at the time of Oslo and the disengagement and remember how hard we worked to recover from that shut-down, make this request of you – enough.

Discussing fateful questions - and the question of annexation is indeed a fateful one - must take place. It must take place in every country that wants the best for its people. Each person has their own view of the world. This is the stuff of Israeli democracy.
We do not flinch at the critics or the questioners, but we must beware of those who silence the conversation. We must not prevent questions, doubts or criticism from any political side

Friends, now is the time to buy Blue and White!
(It's also really tasty!)

A fascinating visit to @ElbitSystemsLtd. I thanked them for the incredible speed with which they sought solutions for @coronavirus, producing a portable ventilator and comms systems for hospitals. Our advanced technological capacity is the heart of our security advantage

Delighted to welcome Alternate Prime Minister and Minister of Defense Benny Gantz @gantzbe for our first working meeting. We talked at length about the regional situation and issues at the heart of our nation's concerns. Good luck, Benny!

Special event at Beit HaNasi visitors' center today - 45 students from Liebler @YavnehCollege in Melbourne had a virtual tour and an Israeli Hope workshop looking at Israel’s diverse and complex society. 
Thanks to partners @JewishAgency and @makomisrael

Mourning the loss of Rabbi Dr Norman Lamm ז"ל, former President of YU and Rosh HaYeshiva of RIETS. Rabbi Lamm brought together great knowledge with deep religious thought, Torah u'Mada, a leader of Centrist Orthodoxy in the US. Deepest condolences to his family and many students.
"Celebrate the Festival of Shavuot with the first fruits of the wheat harvest" (Exodus 34:22)

A wonderful reception on my visit to Yeshivat Kfar Haroeh today for Shavuot and to learn with the students and rabbis. Rabbi Akiva said 'love your fellow as yourself; that is the greatest rule of the Torah’ and they find the threads that connect us, building bridges, not barriers

Speaking this morning to Australian PM @ScottMorrisonMP following the decision that Malka Leifer is fit to stand trial, I repeated what I said on my visit there: Israel will not allow anyone to use its institutions to evade justice. Our courts proved that once again yesterday.

Holding my first working meeting today with FM @Gabi_Ashkenazi. We spoke about the regional situation and the importance of @IsraelMFA and its people in advancing our diplomatic relations around the world. I wish him, and us, great success!

Happy 72nd birthday to the Israel Defense Forces, the best army in the world! I salute you!
@IDF

Marking a year since my wife Nechama's passing, bringing soldiers at roadblocks cheesecake ahead of the Shavuot holiday. This was the way Nechama ז"ל showed her thanks, her love and concern for those ensuring our safety. Chag Sameach!
First working meeting this morning with Speaker of the @KnessetIL Yariv Levin. We agreed to continue to work together on behalf of the people of and the State of Israel.

Today, 1 Sivan, marks one year since my beloved Nechama, my wife and mother of our children, passed away.
Because of construction work at Har Herzl we will not visit the grave and will hold a small family gathering in her memory.
The longing for her strengthens a little every day
Thank you to the Peruvian authorities for their response to my request regarding Hodaya Monsongo. I hope this is a step towards her full release soon.

Wishing Israeli Muslims warmest wishes for #EidAlFitr
Kul am wa-antum b'kheir!

المواطنون المسلمون في إسرائيل، اهنئكم بمناسبة حلول عيد الفطر السعيد. كل عام وأنتم بخير.
#عيد_الفطر

53 years since the Six-Day War and the War of Attrition that followed it. We will never forget the heroism, the sense of duty ,the sacrifice: the determination to win and remove the threat from the State of Israel. May the memories of those who gave their lives be with us forever

As the Hellenic Republic and the State of Israel mark 30 years of full diplomatic relations, President Sakellaropoulou and I issued a joint declaration to continue to work in close cooperation and coordination to advance friendship and partnership between Greece and Israel 🇮🇱🇬🇷
May the memories of the Jews of Ethiopia, our brothers and sisters who lost their lives on their way to Jerusalem and Eretz Yisrael, be in our hearts forever.

Hosting the final of the Michal Sela Hackathon to find life-saving technologies to combat domestic violence, in memory of Michal who was murdered by her husband last October. For many women, it comes too late. For many others, it can save lives. Congratulations to the winners.

Meeting today with 130 CEOs and employees from companies who are part of Co-Impact, an initiative for Israel's largest companies to increase the number and quality of Arab workers. Equality and partnership are not a luxury. They are the basis of our shared lives in this country.

Israel's new government has been sworn in. Let us hope that the 35th government will serve all our citizens, successfully addressing the challenges we face. 
Ministers - bear the responsibility you have assumed with humility. The entire people is looking to you.

Paying a condolence call on the family of Staff Sergeant Amit Ben Yigal ז"ל today. A hero who has become a symbol for us all. Dedicated, a Zionist, full of life, taken from us so soon. Too soon. 

Photo: Mark Neyman (GPO)

Speaking with President Egils Levits of #Latvia today. We stand in solidarity with the Latvian people, and we will continue to work together to find solutions to the global health crisis. I look forward to welcoming you in Israel as soon as possible, @valstsgriba !
Without agriculture, Israel has no independence. Starting this year's wheat harvest at Kibbutz Sa'ad. Yehuda the farmer even let me ride in his combine harvester!

Speaking to President Milo Đukanović of Montenegro today, I said the international community must face #coronavirus together as it crosses boundaries and touches all peoples. We will continue to work together to find solutions to make our world safer again. 
@predsjednik_cg

I spoke to my friend the President of Germany to mark 55 years of diplomatic relations between our countries. Unfortunately #coronavirus kept us apart. Israel-German relations have strengthened in recent years and cooperation, so important right now, will continue to flourish.

At this difficult time, my thoughts are with the family of Master Sergeant Amit Ben Yigal who fell last night defending us all. Heartbroken at youth cut down in its prime. Our forces will reach the despicable terrorists and justice will be done. May his memory be a blessing.

Speaking today with Gov @PhilMurphyNJ of New Jersey, expressing our solidarity as we fight coronavirus. Thank you for your important work to combat antisemitism and your commitment to the Jewish community, particularly at this sensitive time. We hope to see you in Israel soon!

I call on the government not to ignore their calls and to pay the full amount promised, a need even greater with #coronavirus. The new government should set out a 5-year plan, with municipal leaders, and ensure it properly answers the needs of Druze and Circassian authorities.

Meeting today with heads of Druze and Circassian local councils and spiritual head of the community Sheikh Muafak Tarif. They requested help with budgets promised to them by the government. We are committed to equal rights for all Israelis. Ours is a covenant of life and equality

Tomorrow we mark 75 years of the victory over Nazi Germany, the world's liberation from the cruelest evil. For Yuri Rudinsky and all the heroic Allied veterans who came to #Israel to build a home, we remember every day the right of the Jewish people to be free in our land
#VEDay

A letter regarding assigning the task of forming a government to MK Benjamin Netanyahu was just sent to the Prime Minister’s Office and the Office of the Speaker of the Knesset was also informed, following the request of 72 Members of Knesset to the president earlier today.

Representatives of @Kachollavan19 andd @Likud_Party have just presented DG of Beit HaNasi and Legal Advisor to the President with the document signed by @Knesset members requesting the president assign the task of forming a government to MK Benjamin Netanyahu

Visiting the #Israel Institute for Biological Research today with DM @naftalibennett. They have made a world-class breakthrough, identifying a series of antibodies to fight #coronavirus. The dedication and passion of the scientists is truly inspiring.

A unique comms system to connect ICUs and a ventilator assembly line for #coronavirus patients - just two of the incredible developments by the @IDF's Intelligence Branch's tech unit that I saw on my visit today. Thank you for your round-the-clock dedication to #Israel's security

I mourn the passing of Gaon Rabbi Nachum Eliezer Rabinowitz זצ"ל, 'a lion who came up from Babylon', who educated thousands and established an outstanding Beit Midrash. A gentle man with a sharp mind, with Torah and science as his guides. Condolences to his family and pupils.

Story time with the wonderful book Yael's House, written by Miriam Roth, illustrated by Ora Eyal and publixhed by Sifryat Poalim. 



Boys and girls - and the young at heart - please join me and Yael!

(video - Avi Kanner)

Speaking to @NYGovCuomo about the #coronavirus crisis and the tough times New York State and NYC, including our brothers and sisters in the #Jewish community, are going through. We stand with them all and will carry on working together to fight this terrible disease. 
@NYGov

The #IsraelPrize ceremony at the end of every #IsraelIndependenceDay is all about the future. This year we could not honor the recipients in person, but I sent them my warmest greetings . 
Dear laureates, you embody Israeli excellence and our diverse society. We are proud of you.

L'Chaim! Every year, as part of our Independence Day celebrations, Beit HaNasi hosts a reception for the diplomatic and consular corps. This year, we held the traditional gathering online.
Chag Atzmaut Sameach! 🇮🇱

Taking part in the Foreign Ministry cadets' #IsraelFlagChallenge for #IsraelIndependenceDay and flying the Israeli flag for the world to see, in a clip from my recent visit to Melbourne where I met kids from all the Jewish schools there. Chag Atzmaut Sameach! 🇮🇱
@IsraelMFA

Congratulations to the winner of the World Bible Quiz for Youth, Ruth Hacohen from Gadera. "Many daughters have done valiantly, but you excell them all." Well done to all competitors from Israel and around the world, on your knowledge and learning!
#IsraelIndependenceday

Many congratulations to @BorisJohnson and @CarrieSymonds on the birth of their son! The people of #Israel, today celebrating #IsraelIndependenceDay, send our warmest wishes to you and all your families.
Chag Atzmaut Sameach, #Israel! 🇮🇱

Our prayers are with the victim of the stabbing attack by a terrorist in Kfar Saba today, and for her speedy recovery. 
We will act decisively and uncompromisingly against terrorism in order to ensure the security of our people, wherever they are.
We will remember them all

Best wishes to the Druze community celebrating Nabi Shuaib. Ours is truly a profound  bond of life. May it continue and flourish.
نتقدم لإخوتنا الدروز بأطيب الأمنيات بمناسبة زيارة مقام النبي شعيب عليه السلام.
إن العهد الذي بيننا هو عهد حياة أصيل، وسيظل ينمو ويزدهر لسنوات عديدة.

This year, we won't be able to meet at ceremonies, shows and celebrations. So, for #Israel's 72nd Yom Haatzmaut / Independence Day, I decided to come to you, wherever you are 🇮🇱. 

Want to meet? Follow the link:

Ramadan Kareem! May all our prayers be answered.
Kul 'am wa-antum b'khir!
رمضان كريم مواطني الدولة المسلمون.
عسى أن تُستجاب صلواتنا، وأن نعود لحياتنا العادية المُباركة في القريب العاجل ونحن بصحة وعافية. . كل عام وأنتُم بخَير!

This year, we mark the 300th anniversary of the birth of the Vilna Gaon. As a Rivlin, followers of the Gaon who came to #Israel in accordance with his wishes, I spoke today with President @GitanasNauseda of #Lithuania. I hope to find a way to honor his memory and legacy together.

This year, we could not walk with March of the Living, but this year a field of virtual memorial signs lines the railway tracks from Auschwitz to Birkenau death camps. 
I was honored to lay the first sign and invite you all to join me to say #NeverMeansNever @MOTLorg
Our thoughts are with the families grieving for the loss of loved ones today in the #NovaScotiaShooting, and with all Canadians. We pray for the full and swift recovery of those injured.

I heard the protest of the self-employed outside Beit HaNasi and invited its leaders to come and talk. This is an emergency and I promised them, and all self-employed people, that policy-makers will hear what they say. We need to see the big picture without abandoning anyone.

Important meeting today with FM @KahlonMoshe and UN MEPP Special Coordinator @nmladenov, together with @cogatonline @IDF. We were briefed on the current situation of joint resources and thinking with the Palestinians to halt the spread of #coronavirus, which knows no boundaries.

This morning, I informed the Speaker of the Knesset that I am entrusting the Knesset with the task of forming a government, according to Article 10(a) of Basic Law: The Government (2001). I hope majority of MKs can be found as soon as possible. preventing a 4th round of elections

I was wondering whether to write again before the Chag. Sometimes, it is better to speak out and accept the anger face-on. You were angry with me this week about a wrong decision I made and had no justification. This time, I am doing things differently. 
Chag Sameach, the Rivlins

The request was made as required by the president, with the support of both sides and on the understanding that they are close to reaching an agreement. The time for forming a government will be extended and will now expire on Wednesday 16 April at midnight.

In accordance with his statement yesterday, President Rivlin received a request before midnight on Monday 13 April from Chairman of Kachol Lavan, Benny Gantz MK, to extend the period of time allocated to him to form a government.

Speaking today with heads of churches in Israel: the Greek, Latin and Armenian Patriarchs of Jerusalem, the acting head of the Greek Melkite Catholic Church in Israel and the Franciscan Custos of the Holy Land, I wished them and their communities a happy #Easter

The economic and social crisis we face is no less severe than the health crisis and we must address it no less seriously. Speaking today with senior #Israeli business leaders, I called on them to close the digital gap in our society, connecting all those who need it.

To all those celebrating in #Israel and around the world, we wish you

Happy #Easter 
חג פסחא שמח 
عيد #فصح_مجيد
Beatus paschae
καλό #Πάσχα
Շնորհաւոր Սուրբ Զատիկ
Feliz #Pascua
Buona #Pasqua
መልካም ፋሲካ

Credit: Lilium longiflorum (Easter lily) - Dotan Rotem @rashut_hateva

A special Pesach storytime reading from the Hagada:



Even if we are not celebrating Seder night as usual don't forget the special Pesach traditions and songs. And don’t forget to phone or Zoom Granny and Grandpa, Saba and Savta to wish them Chag Sameach.

Out today to say an enormous thank you from me and from us all to those who are looking out for us - men and women, regular and volunteers, in blue and in green, standing together. @IDF, @israelpolice, Border Police - I salute you!
Our thoughts and prayers are with Prime Minister @BorisJohnson and his family, wishing him a full and speedy recovery.

No modern-day plague can break the chain that stretches back to the exodus from Egypt and binds our people together. Today, more than ever, I feel that we are one family, with a shared history, shared values and a shared destiny.

"Blessed are You, Our God, King of the Universe whose world lacks nothing and who made wondrous creations and beautiful trees for human beings to enjoy."

Saying Birkat HaIlanot, the blessing for trees with new buds, in the garden of Beit HaNasi - this year with masks.
Thank you, Rabbi, and to the religious leadership as a  whole, for efforts to make sure  #Pesach preparations are in line with #IsraelMOH guidelines. A happy, kosher and safe Pesach to us all!

Selling #Pesach chametz today with Sephardi Chief Rabbi of #Jerusalem Shlomo Moshe Amar, I spoke out strongly against the criticism of the ultra-Orthodox community. We must not make false accusations about the spread of #coronavirus based on the bad actions of a few individuals.

While Iran is receiving the overseas humanitarian aid it needs from some members of the international community, it continues to sow terrorism in Lebanon and Syria and to accelerate its nuclear program. #Israel will not permit this reality, even in the current circumstances.

Speaking today with President @EmmanuelMacron, UN Special Coordinator @nmladenov and British Ambassador to #Israel @FCONeilWigan, I said that international cooperation is crucial in our battle against #coronavirus.

Mourning the loss of Krzysztof Penderecki, a great Pole, eminent artist and true humanist. His 7th Symphony, The Seven Gates of #Jerusalem, was composed for the 3000th anniversary of our capital city. Maestro Penderecki was a true friend of #Israel. May his memory be a blessing.

LIVE NOW: Storytime with President Rivlin, this week reading Shmulikhedgehog by T. Carmi and Shoshana Heiman

Facebook (Hebrew): 

YouTube:  (English),  (Arabic)

Meeting with the FM and the heads of the situation room at @IsraelMFA who briefed me on repatriation flights for Israelis returning home. Thank you to the MFA's people, true emissaries, for their dedicated diplomatic work around the clock. Today, and every day, we salute you!

Speaking to the Minister of Health and PMO today following the @IsraelMOH decision to move the elderly and frail, including Holocaust survivors, from their hospital beds to care for #coronavirus patients. The decision should be reconsidered. We must not abandon our elderly.

I sent messages for the speedy recovery of HRH Prince Charles @ClarenceHouse, PM @BorisJohnson, HSH Albert II and PM Serge Telle of #Monaco who have contracted #coronavirus, which ignores national borders. International cooperation is vital to beat it. Together, we will overcome.

Speaking today to the presidents of #Austria, #Cyprus and #Geece about #coronavirus , I wished their citizens good health and heard how the countries are dealing with the spread of the virus. They expressed their support and solidarity with #Israel. We appreciate your friendship!

LIVE NOW: Storytime before bed with President Rivlin, this week reading the wonderful 'Tfilayla / Night Prayer'

In Hebrew: 

With English subtitles:

Our meeting marked 41 years since the 1979 Israeli-Egyptian Peace Treaty was signed, a cornerstone of regional stability taking great courage and leadership from both sides. May our relations continue to flourish, bringing benefits to both our peoples and the region as a whole.
أخبرت سعادة السفير المصري خلال لقائي به على خلفية الأزمة التي نمر بها جميعا، أن إسرائيل ستعمل على تعزيز التعاون مع مصر وشعوب المنطقة في محاربة وباء كورونا.
Meeting with #Egypt's ambassador to #Israel in light of #coronavirus, I said that Israel will cooperate in any way with Egypt and the peoples of the region in the fight against the disease.
President Rivlin's address to the nation on YouTube (Hebrew):

Each side must understand the other’s red lines and to be flexible on them, on the understanding that we have – we simply do not have – an alternative. Join together for the good of the Israeli people. If not now, when?

Have at the forefront of your minds the terrible disease that is assaulting us and is claiming the lives of our loved ones, that is grievously damaging Israel’s economy and the homes of so many who are battling to survive financially.
I appeal to you from here, leaders of the main parties, to find a way to present a shared leadership, a responsible leadership, for Israeli society in its time of crisis.

Now that the Speaker of the Knesset has resigned, I am sure that the order of the High Court of Justice will be implemented and Israeli democracy will emerge strengthened and more resilient from these testing times.
It is inconceivable that anyone would not do so.

And yet, despite the deep fissure between the camps and despite the ferocious rhetoric between the sides, I know that the vast majority of Israel’s leadership, left and right, knows that it is the duty of every one of us to obey the rulings of the courts.
We are witnessing confrontations of the most severe kind between the judiciary and the legislature.

My fellow citizens, obedience and listening to instructions is not the duty of Israeli citizens alone. In these fateful days, the are also the primary duty of the elected officials, the public’s leaders, teachers and guides, from all parts of society.

To follow the instructions of the Ministry of Health, to follow the instructions of the government, to follow the instructions of the emergency and rescue forces. Even if we criticize the instructions, and even if we think they are wrong, we must listen to them and carry them out

LIVE NOW: President Rivlin's statement to the nation
At a time when here, in the State of Israel, we are burying our dead simply, holding weddings with no guests, closing yeshivot, synagogues, schools and universities; in these moments of crisis, we must also learn to obey

At this difficult time, my heart is with the families dealing with the loss of their loved ones from this terrible virus, and with a distant, awful parting. I am full of thanks and admiration for the medical staff helping the sick and their families. Guardian angels.

Speaking today with the president of #Croatia, who took office in January, I said I was sorry that #coronavirus was our first occasion to talk. I thanked him for the assistance in getting 70 #Israeli students back home and stressed our strong and important bilateral relations.

Speaking today with the president of #Czechia about #coronavirus, I said #Israelis are standing with #Czechs in solidarity. The spread of the disease and steps taken by both governments are similar. Both peoples knew how to overcome past challenges and will know how to rebuild

Excellent meeting with my friend  Minister of Defense @naftalibennett. Long discussion about #Israel's preparations to combat #coronavirus and the solutions our people are working on so our emergency forces can work to the best of their ability.

Following my approach to the King of #Thailand the Thai authorities have decided that Nati Hadad will be transferred to serve the rest of his sentence in #Israel. My thanks to the King of Thailand and those involved in handling the process,  led by MK Ayelet Shaked.

With the spring, a time of hope and life even during these challenging times, I wish the peoples of all countries celebrating #nowruz2020 good health, the joys of family, and friendship between all peoples.
نوروز مبارك!

Photo - Ophrys umbilicata
Credit - Beit HaNasi (courtesy)

Meeting with Minister of Labor, Social Affairs and Social Welfare Ofir Akunis about #coronavirus. For many, staying at home for a long period of time is difficult and domestic violence is a particular problem. Thanks to all the teams helping those in need at this time

Speaking with President @dodon_igor of #Moldova about #coronavirus today, I thanked him for helping over 800 #Israeli students leave the country and agreed to continue our cooperation to fight the virus.

Speaking with the President of #Armenia today about the #coronavirus, we discussed possible cooperation and information exchange about how our health systems are dealing with the disease.
@armgov

Speaking today with King Felipe of #Spain about #coronavirus, I told him we in #Israel are with the Spanish people as they deal with its spread. I thanked him for the cooperation of the Spanish airports in helping Israelis get home from South and Central America. 
@CasaReal

Ai nostri carissimi fratelli e sorelle della comunita' ebraica della Diaspora:

To our dear brothers and sisters in Jewish communities around the world (Italian subtitles):



@IsraelinItaly 
#IsareleConiItalia
#Andra_tutto_bene 
#iorestoacasa
Cartoon credit: Shay Charka / The Israel Cartoon Project

العالم بأسره يواجه أزمة لا تفرّق بين بني البشر وبين مناطق السكن. تحدثت الآن مع رئيس السلطة الوطنية الفلسطينية محمود عباس وقلت له أن قدرتنا على العمل والتعاون أثناء الأزمة هي شهادة على قدرتنا على العمل معاً أيضا في المستقبل لصالحنا جميعاً.

The whole world is dealing with a crisis that does not distinguish between people or where they live. I just spoke to PA chairman Mahmoud Abbas. Our ability to work together in times of crisis is also testament to our ability to work together in the future for the good of us all.

Meeting with Chairman of the @JewishAgency @Isaac_Herzog for an update on the situation in #Jewish communities around the world. When every country is calling its citizens to deal with the crisis together, we in #Israel have another 'together' - our brothers and sisters overseas.
With every update on the spread of  #coronavirus that we hear from around and the world we also think of you, our family abroad, and pray that you are staying strong, united, healthy and well.

My fellow Israelis, the restrictions do not mean holidays! Please, take very good care of yourselves. I know that being closed up at home is not easy, that children need open spaces and parents need some breathing room. But, nevertheless, we must not make these leisure days!

An honor to to open the 23rd @KnessetIL. The necessity of compromise, to make painful and deep compromises, is the will of the people itself. Dear Members of Knesset, I ask only this: give this people a government.
LIVE NOW: Assigning the task of forming Israel's government to MK Benny Gantz, leader of Kachol Lavan

I emphasized that they should continue and intensify direct contacts between them and between the Likud and Kachol Lavan negotiating teams and welcomed their willingness to do so. At the end of the meeting, the sides agreed that the negotiating teams will continue the discussions
At the beginning of the meeting with head of Likud MK Benjamin Netanyahu and head of Kachol Lavan MK Benny Gantz

Emergencies have never damaged Israeli democracy, but strengthened it and made the State of Israel more resilient. We are committed, more than ever with the urgent need for a government, to hold essential democratic processes even in a time of crisis.
LIVE NOW: Cotinuing consultations with parties ahead of forming Israel's next government (Hebrew only)
LIVE NOW: President Rivlin's consultations with representatives of parties ahead of formation of new government (Hebrew only)

I spoke to head of Kachol Lavan Benny Gantz and repeated my support for a government as soon as possible to deal with the national crisis. 
Again, my house is open to the parties for discussions, in parallel to the accepted democratic process of consultations with the parties.

I have just spoken to the prime minister and told him I welcome any initiative to form a government as soon as possible. 
Beit HaNasi is available to the parties to meet and talk. I am ready to help in any way to get to agreement as quickly as possible for the citizens of Israel

Learning (from the very best) how to sanitize my hands properly. Listen to the instructions and follow them. Keep healthy, everyone.
@mda_israel @IDF @IsraelMOH

There are many who are looking here with hope that answers will come from this house. The answers are for you to find, those who the public elected as its leaders, and I hereby place the task in hands once again.

Among other options, you have the outline I offered at the last elections. I am certainly aware of the criticism of the outline that I presented then and agree with much of it. But I did not believe there was another way and, even today, the situation has not changed a great deal

This is the place to remind party heads and elected officials that this house, and I personally, are at your disposal for any serious and genuine conversation you may wish to hold. Any agreement that produces a stable government that gains the trust of the people will be welcomed

On behalf of the people of Israel, all citizens of Israel, I would like to thank you, members of the Central Elections Committee, for taking upon yourselves this task from a true sense of public duty and commitment to the democratic values of the State of Israel.

At this point in time, which has turned the last year into an exhausting year of elections, the Central Elections Committee has been an anchor of stability, the gate-keeper of Israel’s order and of the sensitive democratic mechanisms that are so precious.
LIVE NOW: President Rivlin receiving the official results of the elections to the 23rd Knesset:

With the 4th graders of Henrietta Szold school in #Jerusalem, who told me what costumes are popular and brought mishloach manot for #Purim. 
On the instructions of @IsraelMOH we didn't shake hands. To be honest, I'm thinking of foot bumping even on normal days now. Chag Sameach!

Meeting with Minister of Health Yaakov Litzman, director-general of the ministry and the @IsraelMOH team who updated me on those who have #Coronavid19 and the steps to contain its spread in #Israel. Thank you for your dedication and great care for the welfare of all Israelis

Visiting @IDF Central Command today we followed the instructions of @IsraelMOH and avoided shaking hands. I was proud to salute instead. 

Whether or not you are in isolation, back from overseas or here at home, following the instructions will help keep us all healthy and safe.

I want to thank our dear friend @avucic for telling #AIPAC2020 that #Serbia will soon open an official state office in #Jerusalem, our capital. Another sign of the strong and deep relations between our countries and peoples. May many others follow.
Хвала, господине председниче!

Visiting the control center of the Central Elections Committee at the Knesset, a professional and dedicated operation doing everything possible to ensure error-free elections, as always. We can rely on you, chairman Judge Neil Hendel and D-G Orly Ades
@electionknesset
Go out and vote. Every vote is the right one. Every vote is your voice. Go out and make it heard.

Congratulations to @SHEBA_ Medical Center, ranked 9th best hospital in the world by @Newsweek. I spoke to Prof Yitshak Kreiss, DG of the hospital, and thanked him for their dedicated care of patients with #Coronavid19 in the special isolation unit set up for the purpose.

Meeting with Minister-President @ArminLaschet of @landnrw this morning on his visit to Israel. I thanked him for Germany's commitment to fight antisemitism and hatred, and for Nordrhein-Westfalen opening an economic office in #Israel to strengthen our business links

بعثت برسالة إلى الرئيس المصري بإسم دولة إسرائيل، للتعبير عن خالص تعازينا بوفاة الرئيس حسني مبارك، من خيرة أبناء الأمة المصرية وبُناتها. لقد كان من القادة الشجعان الذي أسسوا علاقات سلام جديدة بيننا، وخلقوا فرصة للمصالحة لجميع شعوب المنطقة. عسى أن يحمل إرثه مستقبل أفضل لنا جميعًا.

I sent a letter to the President of Egypt on behalf of the State of Israel to express our deepest condolences on the death of President Hosni Mubarak, a true son of Egypt a devoted servant of its people and a brave leader. May his legacy be a better future for us all.

Meeting this morning with my friend Governor-General of #Australia David Hurley, who was in Jerusalem just last month as part of the International Leaders' Forum. I thanked him for his commitment to the fight against antisemitism and for Holocaust remembrance.

Meeting this morning with Australian PM @ScottMorrisonMP. We deeply appreciate Australia's support for Israel in the international arena, its clear position on the ICC and its contribution to the stability of the Middle East. @pmc_gov_au

Visiting @Australian_Navy at Garden Island in #Sydney this morning, the base for many rescue operations for people and animals caught in the recent fires. Your devotion to mission in the face of the might of nature inspires us all

Ringing the bell this morning at the @ASX stock exchange, opening the day's trading, and then met the large Israeli business delegation accompanying my visit to #Australia. I hope the recent agreement to avoid double taxation will further widen our business cooperation.

An important meeting with @VicGovernor Linda Dessau and Premier @DanielAndrewsMP. We were joined by the large Israeli business delegation with my visit here. These are the people behind the strong relations between #Israel and #Australia, based on shared values and interests

Following the story of 9 year old Quaden Bayles who suffers from bullying at school, I told the pupils about the 'Don't Stand By' initiative we launched last week in Israel against social exclusion and bullying. We must stand up to it wherever it happens

A fantastic meeting this morning with thousands of students from the #Jewish schools in #Melbourne. Wonderful to meet young Jewish people proud of their heritage, proud of their identiy and proud of #Israel 
@MountScopus

Marking 100 years of @khuia in Sydney this evening. On behalf of the State of #Israel I thanked @UIAAUS and @UIANSW for their love of Israel and strengthening the bonds between us.  May we enjoy many more years of Zionism and solidarity. Kol Yisrael arevim zeh l'zeh!

Visiting the wildlife hospital at @tarongazoo #Sydney where animals hurt in the  brushfires are treated, including Baxter the koala. 
I told the veterinary team of our own animal hospital in Beit Dagan where we treat animals with the same compassion on the other side of the world

Starting our official visit this morning in #Australia by meeting Premier @GladysB of New South Wales. Thanks for your warm reception! 🇦🇺🇮🇱
@IsraelinOZ
Bula from #Fiji! With wonderful singing and dancing, we were welcomed to an official dinner hosted by @PresidentFiji. I gladly followed the local dress code - a refreshing change!

A historic summit meeting in Nadi, #Fiji with leaders of Pacific Island states - @VisitPNG, @SamoaGovt, #Vanuatu, @TuvaluGovt, #Tonga and #Palau. Another step in deepening our bilateral and regional relations.

I was happy to tell regional leaders today that from August 2020 we will offer 100 new scholarships for agriculture students from Pacific Island states to study in Israel. We will also open a center of excellence and innovation, together with @UniSouthPacific

Thank you to my dear friend @FijiPM Frank Bainiaramra for the warm wecome and for hosting the historic summit between Israel and Pacific Island states leaders. #Israel and #Fiji work together in a range of areas and we will work to deepen those relations.
With the sun rising over #Fiji on Thursday morning, we were received in a moving official ceremony with Hatikva playing in the background

Deeply grateful to be honored by the Y&S Nazarian Center for @IsraelStudies at #UCLA today, marking a decade of the center's establishment. Many thanks to the Nazarian family for their immense contribution to the city of LA, the #Jewish community and the State of #Israel
Making my way from #Israel to #Fiji on our way to a state visit in #Australia

With the @Conf_of_Pres this morning, talking about 3 challenges we face: fighing #antisemitism and racism, deepening the bonds with global #Jewish communities and ensuring bipartisan US support. The US-#Israel strategic alliance must remain above politics and election campaigns
Proud to launch this campaign against online bullying and social exclusion with many of #Israel's young influencers. Follow #לא_עומדים_מהצד  in Hebrew for more

Meeting with ambassadors from African countries to Israel, I spoke about the UNCHR's list singling out Israeli companies. Boycotting Israeli companies does not advance peace or build confidence between the sides. We hope our friends will oppose this outrageous political decision.

A moving family occasion this evening at Beit HaNasi. Together with representatives from Israel and the Jewish world we strengthened the crucial relations between Israel and the global Jewish community

Although we do not promote private businesses here in this house, when Israeli businesses are under the threat of boycott, we will stand with them.

23 years since that night when 73 of our sons, on the way to defend us all, were taken from us - never to return. Today, Israelis everywhere embrace and salute the families of the victims of the helicopter disaster. May their memories be a blessing forever.

Three generations of Israeli artichoke growers came to Beit HaNasi today with baskets overflowing with their wonderful produce. Always very happy to welcome our growers and farmers here. Happy #TuBishvat to you all!

I have written to President @MartinVizcarraC to request clemency for Hodaya Monsongo, a 24 year old Israeli with medical and mental health issues held in #Peru for several months facing charges of drugs smuggling

Visiting the Nirim youth village, named for First Sergeant Nir Krichman ז"ל who was killed in a Navy Seals operation in Nablus. I met the young people at risk living at this wonderful place. For many, this is their last chance before jail. Here, they get their lives back on track

Praying for the recovery of the injured soldiers being treated in hospital today. I am confident the forces pursuing the perpetrator will find him soon and bring him to justice. We will not allow despicable terrorism to raise its head and will fight it without compromise

A greener future is a rosier future for everyone. Meeting today with representatives from the 'Change of Direction 2020' plan led by Dr Dov Khenin. They set out achievable goals for Israel to deal with climate change. I am sure we can lead the world in the field of sustainability

Welcome to Jerusalem! Welcoming 30 outstanding officers from the US armed forces to Beit HaNasi this morning. Thanks to @jinsadc for advancing and deepening the security relations with the #US, our most important ally.

Concluding my visit to Germany meeting heads of Jewish communities from around the world. @WorldJewishCong
I expressed my concern about the antisemitism some communities face and promised we will continue to work according to 'All Israel Is Responsible For One Another'

Here with me today are the Goldin and Shaul families. Five and a half years ago during Operation Protective Edge IDF Lieutenant Hadar Goldin and First Sergeant Oron Shaul were killed. Their bodies are still held by Hamas.

It is no simple matter and both sides need to study the plan in depth. It is a plan that demands deep, difficult and complex concessions from both sides but we must not give up, for those who surrender, surrender the chance - and I refuse to surrender.

Yesterday in Washington we saw moments that could bring great hope. After long years of diplomatic stalemate
President Trump, a courageous friend of the State of Israel, presented a plan that could allow the two peoples to renew  dialog and make progress towards a shared future
In the face of a political vision such as this, a leadership such as this there is only one possibility: we must isolate it and we must denounce it until its murderous aspirations have been defeated.

We are not in 1938, but we will not turn a blind eye when they give terrorist organizations on our borders hundreds of aircraft and trucks filled with dangerous weapons including precision missiles which have one target - to hit Tel Aviv and Jerusalem and other Israeli cities.

The threat posed today by the Iranian leadership is not theoretical. For us, it is existential. We are not the ones to describe it like this, but rather the Iranian leadership, which definitively claims that it aims to destroy the State of Israel as its political-diplomatic goal

We do not have the privilege of ignoring either the Iranian leadership’s policy or its rhetoric. We all know well how rhetoric that preaches hatred, hatred of Israel, to destroy it, how dangerous it is. We all know its power.

I believe and wish that the people of Germany and its leaders will continue, in the coming decades, to repel hatred and incitement and continue to set an example of leadership for whom historic commitment, responsibility, moderation and toleration, are its guiding lights.

If Germany fails trying to prevent the disaster, others everywhere are likely to fail. If, in the place that the Holocaust of the Jews was born Jews cannot live freely, they cannot live free of fear anywhere in Europe.
This is a war that we must sign up for generation after generation. To uproot the weeds, wherever they grow, day after day. We must not relent. Germany must not fail.

Human rights, liberty and human solidarity also went up in smoke from the crematoria at Auschwitz. And that is the most central and jarring message of the Shoah: that Shoah – destruction - can happen.

Let me immediately make it clear: we are not in the 1930s. We are not on the brink of a second Shoah or anything like it. But we cannot ignore the old-new antisemitism, the racism and xenophobia directed particularly against Jews Muslims and foreigners once again raising its head

The responsibility that Germany bears is heavy. It is particularly heavy because today, Europe - like parts of the world at large- is again changing, pursued by the ghosts of the past. Conceptions of superiority, nationalist purity, xenophobia, ugly and blatant antisemitism.

Working meeting with German defense minister @akk. I said the strategic-defense partnership between our countries is excellent and it is important to deepen it. We spoke about the challenges of the ME region and I thanked her for #Germany's committment to #Israel's security

Our duty is to fight a determined, clear, uncompromising battle against antisemitism and racism. We reach out to the Polish people today and ask work together for the future of the next generation, respecting history and inspired by peace, justice, tolerance and partnership

This is the time, today, to look at antisemitism and racism which are raising their heads again and threaten to undermine our democratic foundations. We hear the voices of hate today on the internet, the streets and in political life. It is happening across Europe and the world
We remember that during the war the Polish people fought with courage and strength against Nazi Germany. But we also remember that many Poles stood by and even assisted in the murder of Jews

We will forever sanctify the courage of Righteous Among the Nations, including thousands of Poles, who risked their lives to save Jews. But we also remember that these noble people were too few, weaker than Nazi Germany who made Poland the largest site of extermination of Jews

We remember that Nazi Germany initiated, planned and implemented the genocide of the Jewish people in Poland and other places and that it takes full responsibility for it. And we also remember, with distress, that help came from across Europe, and that also demands responsibility

We remember that Poland and the Polish people are victims of the Second World War. We remember over one million Jews were exterminated at Auschwitz, with thousand of Roma and Sinti. And we remember the tens of thousands of Poles exterminated at Auschwitz.

There is no substitute for International Holocaust Remembrance Day at Auschwitz. There is no substitute for this ceremony, with the promise never to forget. For good and for bad, the Jewish people remembers. Preserving memory is a fundamental building block of our heritage

The future lies in the choices we make, especially, those we make together as countries and nations. I hope and pray that from this room, the message will go out to every country on earth that the leaders of the world will stand united in the fight against racism and antisemitism
At a time when more and more survivors are leaving us, this gathering is an expression of our shared commitment, to pass on the historical facts and lessons of the Shoah, to the next generation.
This evening as we remember the victims of the Holocaust, and World War Two, we also mark the victory of freedom and human dignity.

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke today by telephone with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. The two discussed cooperation regarding the coronavirus, especially vaccines and mutual recognition of the green passport.

The three leaders also held a working meeting with their countries' professional teams. The heads of government and their representatives discussed the fight against COVID in all its aspects including exit strategy, reducing regulation between the countries and the green passport
PM Netanyahu: "The last thing that I want to say is to thank the many people who sent well wishes to my wife Sara. I visited her a few hours ago in the hospital. She is doing better. Recovering."

We discussed this. I have to say that there is interest in cooperating on this. This creates a capability for our countries that is I think more significant when we do it together. We are better together.

It would be an important addition to add Hungary and the Czech Republic to this but equally to see how we can involve both Czech Republic and Hungary in the international plant that we want to build here in Israel for the production of the vaccines of the future.
PM Netanyahu: "We discussed a number of ideas. The first is exchanging green passports as we've done with several countries already.

We appreciate the fact that they've opened up missions in Jerusalem and also that they assist us on the international stage as true friends do. In the spirt of that friendship, they came here to Jerusalem to see how we can cooperate on COVID.
